Summary: I always enjoy my stay and this Newport-Mesa Hotel location. It's convenient to Starbucks and a variety of dining choices.  The staff is first rate and the housekeeping does a great job to maintain its standards.

Good hotel, next to the highway 55. Only disadvantage was that you have to use your car to get to restaurants or bar, nothing around within walking distance. Breakfast was fine as well, so good hotel for a good price.

The beds at this Best Western are so comfortable! If you stay at a lot of hotels, you know how important that is. The rooms are tastefully decorated and very clean. The breakfast was great, lots of choices. For the area, the room rates are more than reasonable (nearly a steal).

When visiting my daughter at Orange Coast College, I always stay here. The price is typically around $100/night and includes a full breakfast and parking. The rooms are a little outdated, but it's always clean and spacious. There's a mini fridge, single brew coffee pods, a big flat screen tv, and fresh apples and snacks. The staff is always friendly, helpful, and welcoming, and the dining servers are great. After a long flight from Hawaii and then the drive from the LAX, the only thing I wanna do is take a hot shower and sleep in a comfortable bed, which is exactly what I get when I come here. The breakfast selection is huge...from eggs and waffles, to fruit and cereals, everyone can find something they like. The location is convenient, easy to get to, and right across the

I would recommend the Best Western Plus, Newport Mesa Inn, Costa Mesa, CA for anyone traveling to the greater LA region.  Clean, efficient - - gets the job done.  I am also a fan of the BW Rewards program. :)

Friendly, accommodating staff goes out of their way to be helpful. Room was very nice, clean and comfortable. I stay at this property a few times a year and feel very safe and at home.the breakfast is good. I will definitely return when business brings me to the area.

Summary Heading: Good price, spacious room, free breakfast.
Summary: Had to stay here last minute.  Nice friendly staff.  Clean rooms, convenient laundry facility (which we had to use), free breakfast, coffee/tea maker in the room and a  pretty decent rate.  The walls are a bit thin, however, meaning we could hear the neighbors talking, etc.  Overall a pretty good stay.

It's never been a bad experience when I stay at the best Western The employees always make sure that you're a little taking Cara to check in and check out also when you get up to eat breakfast in the morning they go out of their way to help you

Prepare to amazed on the breakfast. It had so many options and you are treated as a VIP. The rooms are great. Staff is very helpful and courteous. They even provide a small welcome basket of goodies (apples, granola bars, chips, and waters) upon arrival.

Excellent value for in town stay.  Clean, comfortable, large room that was quiet.  Excellent hot breakfast with good choices.  Convenient to all downtown areas of Costa Mesa and Newport Beach.  Parking a little tight, but OK.

This Inn was very clean.   Staff was exceptionally nice, great wifi, morning breakfast was better than average for the price of the stay.  I felt safe here, it was quiet (except for the tv in the breakfast room) .  Super close to the airport and freeway, but not noisy.  For business, I would come back again.

We were met by friendly staff on our arrival.  The room was clean and spacious. Guest laundry came in handy.  The pool area was clean and inviting.  Was able to grab a coffee from reception. Breakfast was very good, polite staff and a good choice of food.

We stayed at this hotel from 12/26 thru 12/29 2016. We had a great stay,  hotel was very clean and decorated nice for Christmas. Our room was as we asked for 1st floor. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. We only had one glitch and that was with the shuttle service to The Disney park and back. The shuttle service did not advise the hotel it would return to the hotel at 5:30p and 10:30p instead of scheduled time at 7:30p.Which mean't we did not have ride back to the hotel since the next one did not really leave until 10:30p. The shuttle service really did not try to help. I called the hotel and spoke to Mary, she made a few calls to the ART bus company. They again did not try to help. Mary offered for us to take a taxi but it was 55.00 plus tip. I could not do that to the

Great location for getting around in the area while visiting family members in the area.  Very nice room, very comfortable king size bed, and very nice breakfast, too, for the great price.  Have stayed here before because of the previous comments.

This was a very comfortable, spacious hotel room. King size bed gave us a great nights sleep. The hotel was quiet, the breakfast was the Best Western breakfast, but they had a person serving which was a nice touch. Overall, a great place...just a few minutes from the coast and South Coast Plaza.

Summary Heading: Great Value in Newport Beach area!
Summary: This is a very clean, well managed facility that is in a very good location for work or pleasure in the Newport Beach area. The rooms are very nice and well appointed. The complementary breakfast is better than some of the more expensive hotels. We have been using this Best Western for about 7-8 years and they keep improving.

This hotel is clean, and has a friendly ,helpful staff, Also excellent breakfast.Would highly recommend to family and friends.If you are looking to stay in the Costa Mesa area, this would be an excellent choice.

Summary Heading: Lovely Staff Nice Stay Wonderful Breakfast
Summary: This hotel was peaceful; close to freeway and attraction especially the Triangle (movies, restaurants, night life). ALL the staff was wonderful, room was comfortable and clean, plenty of free parking, and fast internet services.

Used the Gym daily with TV, Aircon and Toilet. Great Basement Car Park. Remember to check in at front before driving down. Need Key to access the door to lift. Wireless on mobile and laptop was great.  If you need to use the cable, get about 4m (12 feet) lan cable as the port is away from the table. Will definitely stay here next time.

Summary: We make it a point to stay at Best Western's in our business and pleasure travels.  They have really stepped it up and this particular Best Western Plus was  a delightful experience and all the whole stay from beginning to end was a 10   I would stay here again when in the area and have already recommened this hotel to friends.

We live about 2 hrs away in the mountains, amongst the tree tops, overlooking a lake, wonderful lifestyle. But, we miss the ocean and the OC environment.  My husband has a lil less than 1 yr to retirements and these getaways this hotel help take some stress out of the daily grind. We adore the location pricing and proximity to beach, fair grounds, shopping and dining choices.  The rooms are really great for our taste and comfort. Pretty hotel and landscape. Breakfast is yummy and staff always kind and friendly. Best Western Plus is pretty amazing with the in room amenities, Apples, bottles water and snacks no charge, awesome selection of toiletry items and free parking .

Safe neighborhood, close shopping & restaurants, close to beach & wharf, and great parking.  This hotel was clean, friendly, has great amenities, and a great breakfast.  The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were decorated nicely.  The room had a coffee make, small fridge, and a microwave.  The front desk also sold some snacks, drinks, toiletries, and medication.  I will definitely stay here again.

Very warm and friendly staff at front desk and housekeeping was superb. The breakfast was beyond average and the staff was friendly in the dining area.  We would definitely return to this hotel again. It was also in a great location near parkways, few miles from beach and near lots of restaurants and shopping.  Very very clean hotel.

I liked the location and easy access to the hotel.  The place was quiet and well kept.  The rooms were very neat and clean.  I enjoyed having breakfast and the staff making me feel as though I was at home.

Summary: I've got to say this is a very nice clean hotel room.  I usually don't write comments, but this room was super clean.  It is the first hotel where the bathroom grout was white!  Carpet and linens were relatively new and very clean.  Big walk in closet too!  Loved this room.  They serve a full breakfast with linen, real utensils, and plenty of tables.  Friendly staff.  Four miles to Newport Beach hot spots and close to the fairgrounds and John Wayne airport.

A larger than normal room, comfortable bed, 42" TV, a much better than average breakfast.  This is a place I would visit again.  Reasonably priced, close to Vanguard and just off CA 55.  There are really no negatives on this place.  Coffee available anytime too!

BW Plus was a much better value than certain hotels in close proximity that cost 2-3x as much.  Room was spacious, good amenities, and very friendly staff.  Highly recommended for business or recreational travelers.

I chose this hotel because of its proximity to Disney first and sea world second. It is a nice clean hotel with spacious rooms. The breakfast finishes at 9.30 sharp and that is a disadvantage specially during vacation. The staff is very helpful and courteous.

Our stay at the Best Western was very enjoyable.  The rooms were very clean and the staff is friendly.  The complimentary breakfast was wonderful.  They also offer free parking.  It was nice having a fitness center with a TV.

Hotel was  beautiful.  The hotel and breakfast staff was very kind and helpful.  The breakfast was delicious too. I would highly recommend this hotel.   It is located a beautiful area.   It's not too far from Hampton Beach and Huntington beach. It's right off the highway.  It is reasonably priced.

I have stayed in a lot of hotels about 300 nights a year, and I was very surprised at the quality of the rooms in this hotel, it has to be one of the best keep secrets. I have only stayed in two other Best Westerns with rooms this nice and one of them was in Germany. great job on this hotel with the rooms and house keeping service.

Summary Heading: Staying close to Long Beach but in Costa Mesa
Summary: Stayed here for an education session but was close enough to walk the beach and ate  at a fabulous restaurant called Gulfstream, seafood is their special. The hotel is older but clean and comfortable. Prices are higher in this area because  you are in the Longbeach area,...Breakfast was a full self serve . Coffee cup refilled often.... Right off freeway, so just jump on and go.

We were in Costa Mesa when the wildfires blocked our way home. It seemed every hotel had increased priced that night, but not the Best Western. The staff was helpful, the room clean. and we got a badly needed breakfast before setting out to find a way home

This hotel is average at best.   The room I had was clean and I appreciated the free snacks.   The free breakfast was not good at all.   Rubbery cold eggs,  odd tasting sausage  and an automatic toaster that did not toast the first run through and burned on the second run through.   There were 3 extremely nice and attentive employees on hand during the breakfast,  which helped.   The hotel must be in the process of remodeling as the best outside parking was taken by work trucks and the prime inside spaces were  full of carpet,  trash,  furniture,  and building materials.   All in all it was just average and what I would expect of a best western.

The breakfast staff was amazing! So happy and informative and helpful and the food was greatüëçüèª

I usually come here just to get away. Always ask for the second floor! Those rooms are nicer. Comfy beds, clean, has a cozy feeling to it. Free parking & breakfast is a plus. I am a regular here & would recommend it to a friend.

Summary Heading: Best Western Plus Newport Mesa Inn Costa Mesa
Summary: I have to say that this was among the finest Best Westerns we have stayed at. Water, fruit, and personal items provided. Linens and bedding were excellent. Everything worked and worked well which is not always the case. The staff was very courteous and polite and actually seemed like they cared to have you stay there again. Breakfast was really good, the best so far at B/W. Last stay in Chula Vista was really discouraging. May not go back again. You will enjoy this Hotel.

It's centrally located for both flying AND regular business! The shuttle took me to the airport and picked me up as soon as I called, the staff was wonderful and the room was clean and quiet. The breakfast the next morning was delicious and plentiful (if you left hungry, it was your fault). For business travel, there's an area to work, as well as for meetings. I have to be back in OC in 2 weeks, and I'll definitely be staying at this hotel! FYI, while the hotel is located on a main Boulevard, you will NOT hear ANY traffic noise at all. I was very impressed.

Breakfast was well stocked and typical for this grade hotel.  Very clean and fresh!

At breakfast, they bake their own gluten free flaxseed muffins in separate pans and utensils to keep them safe from cross contamination. They also had honey nut rice chex in its own serving box.  They do the extras to exceed expectations. Will come back.

The room design was not ideal in that there is no external vanity area - shower, toilet, and vanity are all in one room. The bathroom light switch is also tied to the fan so no light without a noisy fan. Pool was small but area and chairs were nicer than expected.   Overall we were pleased and would stay again.

This is a great hotel and very much what we have come to expect from Best Western properties. I booked online . Check in was fast, efficient . The staff at the desk were Cody and Mellisa and they both were very helpful. I had problems hooking up to the hotel internet and they solved the problem quickly. We went to the restaurant onsite for supper. They serve the free hot breakfast in the same room in the mornings. We wondered if we had made a mistake as there was no one but us. Our server Samantha was very attentive though and we were not disappointed. It was a bit slow and not a lot of selection but food was good and we enjoyed it. The next morning when we went to the free breakfast we were once again greeted by Samantha. 3 other people were working and greeted each guest

Summary Heading: Newport Mesa Best Western is OK
Summary: Large room, dated decor, weak breakfast, friendly staff. Not as high quality as other Best Western Plus I have stayed at, but it was clean and the room was large enough. A little expensive for the quality of rooms and breakfast. At least they had a nice TV in the room, but the cables? They had nothing in the service fridge.

feel the quality of this hotel surpasses from the cleanliness of room ...quality of breakfast... and friendliness of staff definitely a great location and who would not want to see beautiful California especially when leaving snow behind

It is such a convenient location to Vanguard University, shopping, the beach, and Disneyland. A very nice facility. Love the warm breakfast. The parking is great - always a place. The decor is lovely - very comfortable feel. The mattress is was nice. I had a great nights sleep!

Summary Heading: Good Family Hotel - avoiding air noise of Orange County!
Summary: This is a good family hotel.  Friendly helpful staff, clean Quiet rooms, very good breakfast buffet with excellent welcoming staff.  Ask for room at back, away from highway noise. Underground parking is nice option.

After a grueling 4 days doing an exhibition at the Las Vegas convention Center we took ourselves off to visit our daughter in LA so decided to all go to Newport Beach for the weekend and stay over. Lots of hotels to chose from but Best Western Plus looked like it would do nicely. It certainly did, only a short 5-7 minutes from the beach area and easy striking distance to other interesting areas (Orange Old Town, Laguna Beach, Huntington Beach). The hotel entrance easy to access, the reception area open airy and in good condition. Check-in hassle free, rooms: our room was excellent, spacious, well appointed and in great condition with a few neat thoughtful additions; fresh fruit, snacks, and a good selection of teas and coffee, real mugs!! not jut paper cups, clean bagged remote

Our stay was wonderfully nice and friendly and the accommodations was More than we expected a 5 Star Hotel with all the pool, spa, gym, parking with Easy. Front management excellent.  Free coffee, cookies, computers about anything You asked for they would assist you finding.  Cafe serving breakfast and lunch. Rooms great and maids could do enough to help.  All free goodies in your room. Our family members were very happy with children's accommodation. Keep up the good work.  M/M Dartez

this is a very convenient location for the business I have to conduct in the morning. This is my new go-to when doing business in the OC. Of the lower cost options in the area this one checks off all the boxes: safe, quiet newly remodeled room, WiFi, excellent soft goods and a hot breakfast. Some of the other options are great if you missed being an extra in a Fellini movie  book a room at Extended Stay or Ramada and you can live the dream.

Summary Heading: Great value, easy access to CA-55`
Summary: The Best Western Newport Mesa Inn had everything we‚Äôve been accustomed to expect from Best Western ‚Äì a clean, comfortable room, a good, hot breakfast selection and courteous service. The king room was much larger than average, with a sofa, coffee table, desk and dresser. We enjoyed the novel selection of pastries and the type of meat and scrambled eggs varied daily. The only downside was the breakfast room did not have enough seating to accommodate everyone on Sunday morning because they had a meeting in the adjacent room. We would stay here again if we‚Äôre back in the area.

A surprising jewel in Costa Mesa!  We were only there for a night on our way back home from Cambria, but looking forward to coming back for a longer stay next time. Clean, quiet, and lots of ammeneties!  Make sure to check out Urban Greens!  Wonderful food by wonderful women ƒè

I always stay at Best Westerns because one can be assured of exceptionally clean accommodations, good beds, free wifi and parking and almost always breakfast is included.  The Newport Mesa Inn was no exception and I very much enjoyed my stay.  The staff were courteous and very accommodating.  Also, there's a restaurant attached for light dinners - the chicken, pear and feta salad was excellent and service was welcoming.

Clean. Easy access, nesr the Fair grounds, great value. I loved the bed,,like sleeping on a cloud. We had new carpting in our room. Rely big screen tv too.  Free bottle water and apples in the room refrigerator too, coffee maker as well. The linen towels were sooo soft. Breakfast included, but the food was less than savory.  Eggs cold and hard, potatoes awful. Make your own waffles, cereals and toast, juices n coffee. Clean dining room, friendly attendant.

This is a typical upscale Best Western. Though it is just off the freeway and not far from the airport, the location is pretty quiet.  The rooms are nice.  Excellent bed.  Great amenities in the rooms.  They are remodeling.  I was in an older room, but it was still very nice.

The hotel is very nice and great for business travelers. The property is located just off the highway and the grounds are nothing special. However, this is clearly reflected in the much cheaper price compared to other downtown Irvine hotels and the rooms and facilities were much nicer than I expected. Very comfortable bed, large room and bathroom, etc.

Summary Heading: Excellent value, comfortable rooms, very clean and breakfast included
Summary: If you want a clean comfortable place to stay, this is an excellent choice.  It is freeway accessible within minutes.  Reception was courteous and prompt.  The room was spacious with a desk area, sofa, credenza and more than enough electrical outlets for recharging electronics. There was a welcome basket with 2 bottles of water, 2 large apples and 2 energy bars - all complimentary. The bed was comfortable with a mix of large firm and soft pillows. The AC/heat unit is in the wall and it took several adjustment to  get the desired temperature.  The bathroom area included a coffee maker (read the instructins), small refrigerator,a large walk-in closet ,a large safe and plenty of hangers.  There vanity and sink area is adequate for one person at a time.  The toilet and bathtub are

Nice greeting on arrival, changed rooms for my father and mother in law to the ground floor because of their age. Rooms are spacious and perfectly adequate for our stay. Coffee and water at reception is a nice touch. Breakfast is great, eggs, bacon, juices, cereals  Waffles, Toast all you need to set you up for the day. Restaurant ladies are really welcoming and friendly.

We stayed one night to break up the drive home from vacation.  Surprised to find a friendly, helpful staff, and well maintained property. Free breakfast was above average with excellent service. Breakfast room was larger than most in similar motels. Good value for the dollar mid-week. The motel is very close to the Orange County Fair grounds and a great place for anyone attending events at that location.

Stayed two nights on a business trip.  Very close to John Wayne Airport.  Also, close to restaurants within a couple of miles.  Rooms were clean, coffee maker, and not noisy.  Free breakfast included many choices to have plenty to eat.

The management needs customer service and customer satisfaction training. The rooms furniture needs updating and the linens on the bed are coarse and need to be replaced with a high quality and thread count.
Manager Response: Dear Robert,   First of all I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. At Best Western we strive everyday to provide a superior customer service experience. Furthermore,  I am sorry we were not able help you with the NOSHOW charge refund as I said we were sold out and the room was blocked for your arrival.  I wish I could do it.   Hope to serve you in the future,   Sincerely,  Naj Ekhlas General Manager

Summary: Spent two nights recently at the BW Newport Mesa Inn.  From my first phone call, to check out, the employees were top notch.  Room with two queen beds was spotless.  Appreciate the set up with not only a sink in the bathroom, but one outside as well.  Especially with two women!   The small restaurant not only had provided a hot breakfast (included with room), which include eggs, bacon, potatoes, cereal, waffles, toast, muffins, etc. but also dinner.  We had room service two nights and ordered the chicken quesadilla and tacos.  For the money it was quite tasty and so convenient.  Oh and the fresh baked cookies were delicious. And the beds and pillows (4) were super comfy!  I didn't wake up at all both nights...which is super unusual for me! Free wifi connected easily and had no

It was a nice stay.  It was quiet.  Staff was very friendly.  Breakfast was good.  A server is there to serve you the hot breakfast.  Everything else is serve yourself.  Comfortable sleep.  The room has two sinks, one before the restroom and one in the restroom, which was nice.

I spent three nights here recently and was a bit concerned when my boss booked this for me. My past experiences with various BW properties was mixed. This one stands out with larger rooms, reasonably quiet too. The breakfast cafe served various options every day and they were a pleasant surprise. It's about 5 miles from SNA airport and about 30 minutes from Irvine.

We just needed a room near the airport.Got a nice online price and frankly was not expecting much. Wow! Was blown away by the hotel, room & location. Luxurious, comfortable room... impeccably clean and the staff was most friendly. Another bright spot was the breakfast and the in-room snack basket. Don't pass this one up

I should have realized when neither of the TWO toilet paper holders actually had a holder - the paper core was stuffed onto the device, and as soon as you try to tear off paper, the entire roll rolls away...for two holders. Next, I realized a needed to wipe down the bathroom counter because it still had gunk from the prior guests...then I began to notice too many other things to count...needless to say, we won't stay again.

Traveled to Cali again for appt at UCI Med Center and decided to stay closer to the beach and the airport. When I drove up to this place I seriously wasn't sure, especially traveling alone, but my fears were averted upon entering and receiving the warm greeting from Cody at the front desk. The place was very clean, which extended to the rooms. My room even smelled clean. (I HATE funky smell, from funk, weird cleaners or otherwise.) I also had fresh apples, FREE bottled water and fruit and nut bars waiting for me in my room. The hotel offers free on demand TV and movies, and I got to catch up on Insurgent, which I hadn't seen yet. Breakast was included and offered cereals, hot food like belgian waffles, potatoes, bacon, eggs, pastries, coffee, teas, juices. The place was also

Everything at the hotel is awesome.... Everyone was really helpful and went out of their way to make the stay really nice... I needed to be at the airport at 5:30 am their Shuttle starts running at like 8 and they had someone come in just for me to make sure I made it......   The restaurant on the other hand is lacking management I walked in stood there for a few minutes no one showed up so I took a stroll into the kitchen looking for someone.... finally got seated and took extra long to get my food.... The food wasn't bad they just need someone that can run the place....

Summary Heading: Great hotel especially for the price
Summary: We stayed overnight to attend an event close by.  Check in was very pleasant.  Internet and breakfast was included.  Internet was very good but breakfast was a little disappointing because the eggs were cold and they were out of bacon and sausage.  Overall, our stay was pleasant.  The room had a comfortable recliner chair which is a treat at a hotel.  The freeway is very close and you can hear some noise but didn't affect sleep.

Staff was super friendly. Both are rooms were very clean and updated. The beds were comfortable and overall a very nice hotel, especially for the price. Convieniently located, unless you must be on the beach.,

We enjoyed another socal weekend at the Costa Mesa BW.  The bathroom appears to have been redone recently.  We find the location ideal, as we had access to the coast (Balboa Island) and had a wonderful lunch in Huntington Beach on Sunday.  The hotel is clean and the staff are professional and made our stay a welcome experience.

Best hotel on our road trip!!!  The location was magnificent.  The hotel itself was spectacularly appointed.  The food in the attached restaurant was extremely good.  Such a great value.  We highly recommend this hotel.  You will not be disappointed!

Despite being located right on a busy road it is quiet inside. Place was clean, appeared freshly painted and generally well kept.  The room came with a full breakfast but did not have time to take advantage so can't comment on it.  There was coffee in the lobby though.  Overall good experience.

Decent hotel for the price. Noise not to bad. Room and bed was comfortable. Nice neighborhood with food and convenience stores close. I don,t know why trip advisor wants wants me to write a book. just keep it short and simple.

Summary Heading: Excellent breakfast is included with the room
Summary: We spent a total of 7 nights here.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.  There is a smoking area outside the lobby with chairs.  The landscaping was nice. The staff were courteous and helpful. The hotel is near the airport but not too close. It is centrally located to Newport Beach and Costa Mesa.  If you don't want to be on the beach or in the other high priced areas, it is a good location.

Work takes me everywhere from east to west and I was on the west coast in Newport Beach and stumbled upon a quiet Hotel located on Newport blvd. The location was exactly what I was looking for. I was hesitant at first and decided to look around. I struck up a conversation with a local waitress from the restaurant. To my surprise she was the chef in the restaurant that was adjacent. She knew so much about the hotel that you would have thought she owned it. I was so impressed with her opinion of the hotel that I decided to stay. The hotel was exactly what she described. Excellent service from the front desk to the room was outstanding. The next day I had a wonderful breakfast and got the chance to thank her. Make sure to ask for Kathleen if you get the chance. I recommend this

The room was ok. Bed ok. TV was big. Refrigerator worked. Window opened. Shower was a hard straight shot. Not pleasant. Hotel provided shampoo and conditioners terrible. "Free" breakfast terrible. I mean really bad. Plus they rationed the portions of the powdered eggs. Hotel is expensive.

Summary Heading: My first time at a BWPlus Hotel and I was surprised!
Summary: I stayed in this hotel for a business trip and I was a little worried as I'd never stayed in a Best Western hotel and thought it a budget property.  Since the reviews were good on Trip Advisor, I gave it a try and I wasn't disappointed.  The staff were very friendly and the room was great.  Lots of room and tasteful decoration along with a big comfy chair.  There was also a fridge and microwave as well as a coffee maker in the room.  A hot breakfast is included in your meal and there was AMPLE food for a breakfast that would certainly tide you over to supper!! I would stay here again.

Beautiful hotel...great staff...food not so good. The waitress was very helpful. She did everything but cook the food. Hopefully on our next stay the food will improve. Perfect location. Close to shops and not to far from the beaches.

I needed a place near the golf course I was to play and being a frequent Best Western customer, I found this Best Western Newport Mesa Inn. Never stayed there before so as always with a new place wondering how it would be. To my surprise it was a very good choice as the room was great and the local was tremendous. I will stay there again for sure :-)

Summary Heading: Nice hotel close to dining and not far from the harbor
Summary: Good property near the food and shopping in Costa Mesa.  Also not far from the harbor in Newport Beach.  We liked the people and the ambiance.  Room was above average and great for our needs.  Plan to go out to eat and not at their restaurant, there are lots of choices within three miles or so.

Summary Heading: Quiet- clean and a massive closet
Summary: I stayed at a few best westerns and this one is really at the top - the place is clean management actually cares about what you say the pool area is just lovely and relaxing and the rooms are very large and the bed and pillows are super comfortable . I especially enjoyed the  amazing breakfast that the served which has everything I could want including fresh pastries and sausage and eggs . I liked going there in the evening to have a reasonably priced meal in their attached caf√©  .  I'm a huge fan of how quiet the place is with no traffic noise and there's a massive closet you can just throw all your stuff in .  I will definitely be coming back

Clean hotel and easy to get to John Wayne Airport . Great customer services.  Asked for a  microwave in are room and one was brought up right away.  Plenty to eat at the hot breakfast. Easy on and off the 55 hwy not to far away from the beach.

Friendly, helpful staff.  Beds very comfortable,  Breakfast outstanding. Spacious room with recliner.  Telephone at desk would be helpful: also more outlets at desk.  Air conditioner worked well and not noisy.

Summary Heading: Best Western you knocked it out of the park!
Summary: Superb service with a smile. The room was very clean and tidy. We were out on business and every night we were so happy to come back to beautiful hotel with excellence all around us. We were very impressed with the complimentary breakfast every morning. The setup was very classy with a surprisingly delicious meal. I suggest the waffles. We met a fantastic group of people there. Jamie was serving us behind the cookers and Kathleen was cruising around making sure that everything was cleared off. Overall we think Best Western plus is by far one of the best hotels for the buck we have ever stayed at. Thanks again to all the staff.

Polite and helpful staff; quiet and clean and nicely appointed rooms, and really a stand-out Best Western. Very clean pool and whirlpool, and the in-room additional amenities were both a surprise and quite a pleasant welcoming (this was a premium room).

Summary Heading: Best Best Western I have ever had the pleasure to stay in!
Summary: Beds are comfortable, rooms are super clean, staff is professional and attentive, breakfast is complimentary and terrific!  And the best coffee I have ever had in a hotel - it beats Starbucks in my opinion.  While it is near a highway and on a fairly major road, it was quiet.  Even received a thank you from manager Naj thanking me for completing the Best Western survey! And the location was perfect for me!  Just be careful and don't get on that Highway 73 - if you forget to pay the toll when you return home, the fine could be as high as $900!!!

Summary Heading: This stay changed our opinion of the Best Western brand
Summary: We were looking for a place on the beach in Newport Beach and came up empty, so we went a little further inland to Costa Mesa. Best Western has never appealed to us but we were anxious to check in somewhere. When we walked into the lobby we were immediately impressed. The front desk service was great, the facility was beautiful and our room was very nice. Free parking and an outstanding free breakfast were nice features too. The location was the only minor negative, but overall it was great. I even joined their loyalty program, so you know I plan to stay at another Best Western.

Summary Heading: Recommended hotel in Costa Mesa/Newport Beach
Summary: Excellent value/ clean rooms/ great complimentary breakfast,  Great location if you plan to be in the area!  We have stayed here for at least five times and want to convey our appreciation to the staff at this location.

Summary Heading: Great for one night not sure for a holiday
Summary: Stayed here for one night. Checkin was easy, they do charge extra for a roll along bed. Beds will take two people each. Rooms clean and tidy. Shower very good. Pool didn't look as good as in the pictures. Breakfast ok cooked section not brilliant but cold section ok. Highlight of the stay was the waffle maker at breakfast.

Lovely appearance inside and out. Well maintained. Good customer service was allowed to check in 2 hours prior to actual check in time. Front desk was very accommodating. Great value for the money, free airport shuttle and great full hot breakfast. Was able to save money.

Summary Heading: Decent, clean facility, well located and well managed
Summary: Was a guest the night before a flight out of John Wayne Airport, which is my favorite SoCal airport, by far. This hotel served that function well. The hotel rooms are priced reasonably for the value, and it is well located

I went with my family to New port this last weekend and decided to stay here. we were very happy with the cleanliness and the excellent service of the staff. The hotel price was relatively economical but the service felt like  that of much more expensive hotels like Marriott.  I would definitely stay here when I visit NewPort again.

Summary Heading: Difficult parking area to maneuver in with larger vehicles.
Summary: The housekeeping service came in and collected dirty towels that were not able to be reused but did not replace them. when I  went to ask a housekeeper if I could have the towels replaced she couldn't assist me because she didn't speak English and we were unable to communicate with each other. The beds were left unmade and the safety chain that was on the door fell off onto the floor because it was the connection attached to the door frame was damage previously and  not repaired or replaced.       The morning breakfast area was clean and well staffed with very pleasant people. The hot food offering during my stay left a great deal to be desired. It was bland soy chorizo with no tortillas and flavorless pinto beans. Interesting, but tasteless.

Summary Heading: Comfortable hotel with lots of pluses and a few minuses
Summary: My husband and I visited this area to attend a wedding in early July. The wedding was in Newport Beach and we decided to spend 4 nights at this hotel, using it as a base to explore the area. Although we ended up not going farther than Laguna Beach, the hotel's location was convenient because it is close to several major roads. It is also across from the Orange County Fairgrounds. However, there is not much within walking distance of the hotel, other than a Starbucks and small Mexican restaurant that are across a big and busy intersection.  We had reserved a king bed room and got a free upgrade to a business class room, which was very large and pretty nice. It included a basket of snacks (apples, trail mix, and chips) and 2 bottles of water--although the snacks were not replaced

Summary Heading: Good for a Quick Business Trip
Summary: I was in for an interview, I was a little leary about the area, ( OK, I know Costa Mesa is overall nice, but I didn't know this part) so I took a chance. The outside is nicely maintained, and parking was plentiful and easy. You can totally tell the hotel has had a renovation and makeover. I have never stayed with a best western before. The halls were nicely pained and looked pretty clean. My room was nicely cleaned. The only small complaint I had was, in the bathroom, there were three spiders. ewwwww!!!! So I gave  them a shower and they swam down the drain :) other than that, my stay was good. I slept well on clean sheets and checked out by 8:30am. It wouldn't be my first choice to stay but, overall... my stay was a positive one :)

Very good option in the Newport/Costa Mesa area. Lots of thoughtful touches, and going the "extra mile" by the staff. Very comfortable. Very clean. Though it was adjacent to the 55 Freeway, it was very quiet. We especially liked the free snacks in our room!

I found this hotel on the internet for a quick overnight.  Picked it because of the brand and location.  Turned out to be an outstanding property.  Great room, great breakfast, excellent people.  Really, this hotel deserve high rankings for the way it is presented, maintained the the service provided by the employees. Cant say this was "good for the price", this would have been great for even a higher price.  If you are in the area, stay here

A nice, clean hotel in a convenient location. Easy access to highways and close to The Lab and CAMP, my favorite places to shop when I visit the area. Staff were friendly and efficient.  Only suggestion I would make is to update the rooms.  Getting dated and a little worn.

The hotel was only a short drive from Newport Beach and a great value.  My only comments would be that the a/c when I turned it on smelled like mold and the carpet in the bed bath area was frayed and coming apart.  The overall hotel was clean and in a good location. Most of the staff was friendly, however when I went to check out the clerk wasn't very friendly and helpful. Besides this the hotel was clean and a good value for the location.

I love this place, I stay here every year to visit the Orange County Fair with family. Reasonably priced for the area, friendly and helpful staff, conveniently located for business and pleasure, comfortable rooms and a good complimentary breakfast - what more could you ask?

This BW has super comfortable beds!  Conveniently located for visiting in Huntington Beach and Newport Beach. The free breakfast is just what you would expect (go for the fresh waffles) for this type of hotel. Room was large, quiet and very clean.

We stay at this hotel every year when visiting the Orange County Fair.  We've always been satisfied with the staff, cleanliness and overall experience from Best Western and would recommend it to anyone!

We have guests from China attending a convention so we helped to book this Best Western.  In Orange County, this hotel offers very fair price with free breakfast, and very easy commute to Southern California.

Summary Heading: this place has good breakfast and a wonderful staff
Summary: I was in costa mesa because my daughter was checking out he local college and meeting with coaches. I usually try to stay at a best western because I like the chain. We were pleasantly surprised to find out that the O.C. FAIR was in town, the hotel Is 2 blocks from fair entrance. Also, Pat Benatar was playing so we got to take in her show as well! the entire hotel staff was very respectful to me and my family, from the front desk staff, the women cleaning and preparing room, to the young men who served us breakfast and bused our tables, they all were joyful and respectful and made our stay in costa mesa a very pleasant one.

Stayed one night for the US Open and fair.  Comfortable stay, quiet rooms.  Didn't try the caf√© but it sounded better than the usual buffet.  Could park at the hotel and walk to the QC fair. Close enough to the beach to not be a hassle.

Two many words to write down - makes me not want to complete this survey you should change this. I don't think I have enough words to say but we had a great time for the 2 days we were there. We noticed that they did a renovation of the place and looks great. Added room service which we LOVE very much and up scaled the breakfast which is very nice. The staff was so nice and a stay was very pleasant. Robin the chef was awesome - super nice to talk too.

We stayed here for five nights for a business event. The room is pretty average - nothing to write home about. We had two rooms - the first on the first floor which seemed to be more run down than the one on the second floor. What was great about the hotel was that they were willing to switch me rooms - even though they were fully booked - just because I didn't want to be on the first floor. If you're traveling anywhere in Costa Mesa or Newport beach, this place is pretty centrally located. It's also across the street from the fair if that's why you're traveling. It's close to the freeway, it's pretty clean, and the beds are fine. The only big negative I would say was the fact that the rooms feel stuffy. I ended up going to get a fan from Target to move the air around. I don't

Wireless internet was poor, kicking me off frequently.  Homeless sleeping in front of hotel (next to the hotel).  Breakfast was included but was very poor quality.   Didn't feel secure at the hotel due to the homeless in the area.

Friendly helpful staff!  The room was clean and well appointed.  The bed was comfortable, fridge and microwave in the room.  Convenient to the fair, Newport Beach, etc.  Breakfast was adequate.  The pool was sparkling clean and refreshing.  I  recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Very good stay, safe area close to almost every beach. Staff most are good and helpful. Clean rooms, Free breakfast also good breakfast. I would come back ! came with family and kids  Swimming Pool was kinda dirty I would not swim in it.

Nice place to stay, it is close to Huntington and Newport beach.  It is close to the freeway so getting around is easier.  Also it is close to John Wayne airport.  The breakfast was better several years ago.

Summary Heading: Good location but awful service by staff
Summary: This BW is in a good location and worth the money but be aware of the rude staff and eating in the cafe.  One of the staff members was rude and insulting toward my husband and used fowl language when my husband expressed concern about the unsanitary food serving process. This staff member was out of line and should be fired! If you decide to stay, be ware of the rude behaviour of the breakfast staff.
Manager Response: Dear Gladys,   Thank you very much for completing the survey regarding you recent stay at our property.  On behalf of our entire team , I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations at Best Western Plus Newport Mesa Hotel. We will use the feedback you give us to improvement to ensure we provide better experience in the future.   meanwhile, as I spoke with you, once again I have to let you know that we do have rules and regulations which have to implemented and we will follow it.   We hope to serve you better next time.   Sincerely,   Naj Ekhlas General Manager

Summary Heading: The Best of the Best Westerns
Summary: Pleasant, friendly, responsive staff. Clean, welcoming, with everything in working order! A great value compared to the prices of other Best Western's in the area that we have stayed at. We will definitely be back as we have relatives in the area. This was the best Best Western we stayed at during our summer travels this year.

A very good hotel when visiting southern Calif in and around Costa Mesa Calif. Best Western Costa Mesa Calif close to the Beach and Swap Meet  also John Wayne airport is Only 15 to 20 minutes away. The staff is really helpful here

Would definitely stay here again!!!!  One of the best places for the $ we have ever stayed, and we are Motel 6, Super 8, Econolodge, peopleBeautiful, clean, clean, clean, friendly staff, welcoming, with fresh red apples, granola bars in the room, plenty of room, refrigerator, glasses for the ice bucket, nice TV with movie channels, not one but 2 computers with printers that the friendly staff was so willing to help me when I needed to print out my Groupon tickets for the Catalina Ferry.  Mapquest said the hotel was 15 mins away from where we needed to board the Ferry and it was. Beds were comfortable.  The only thing I would change is to have the sink outside of the bathroom so that someone can be taking a shower while another person can be putting on their makeup, brushing

WE enjoyed our stay at this Best Western, we had a basket of goodies waiting for us, rooms were nice and clean! I would  definitely stay again also a great breakfast was served at  no charge!  Only complaint was the beds were a little hard and our A/C was broke!  All in all a great hotel and service!

This is a great location for visiting Newport Beach, California, conveniently located and well managed. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable, there is plenty of parking and the staff is very accomodating.

We love staying at this location. So easy to get to the beaches. The rooms are spacious and very well appointed. Comfortable and clean. Have stayed here many times and will surely return again. One of the best breakfasts of all the BW hotels. The staff are always very pleasant.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel ever missing amenities and billed more than agreed more than once!
Summary: This is the worst hotel I have ever been in my entire life! If the owner/manger had not put up pictures from maybe 20 years ago and lied about the amenities I would never have even booked it with a friends help ever and cancelled with the free cancellation option offered twice! It is too run down and dirty! Hotel has nothing to do with Newport Beach has Costa Mesa zip code! I lived in past in East Costa Mesa and in Newport Beach and know them very well! Hotel is across (what locals now call old Newport Blvd) from Fairgrounds  What now known as Old Newport Blvd because when end of 55 fwy south redone in 1992  it no longer had ability to get to businesses on north side of street by left turn to enter Have to make several left turns to do so if located past Fair Drive,22nd
Manager Response: Dear   Ms. Levin,   Thank you for completing the survey and unrealistic comments and your collecting images regarding your recent stay at Best Western Plus Newport Mesa Hotel.  I apologize that for not exceeding your Expectation. But I want to let you know that per our management decision we have to cancel your second booking for the 7 nights due to in house guests complains and our rule to keep the Hotel quite and better place to all our other guests for  a good night sleep  and to enjoy their stay. Therefor, we regret that we did not have any other choice except to ask you to check out and remove you from property. I am  sorry that we used the authority to help us for your removal from the Hotel because you were not responding our calls.   Sincerely,   Naj Ekhlas  General Manager

Summary: Came for a quick get away and was  pleasantly surprised. Check in was easy even though the computer was slow and held up the process a bit. The young man at the desk (wish he had a name tag) was apologetic and courteous.  The room was nicely appointed and quite clean.  The bed was comfortable and I was glad to see that the blanket was double sheeted. Even the pillows were comfortable. I also liked the basket of snacks in the room when we arrived, nice touch. The breakfast room was large and bright and easy to move around in, even with lots of  people. I am very much into customer service and the breakfast crew delivered, they were good at what they do and seemed to enjoy those they served. My one regret is that this hotel was not right next to  the beach, but if it were, I would

This was the perfect stay for our beach trip.  Close enough for the beach, close enough to get around.  Our room was clean, the staff was very friendly and professional. The breakfast was decent.  The pool and spa were great after a long day out.

Don't miss the opportunity to stay at a finely operated Best Western Plus.  I never stay anywhere else when I travel to Orange County, California.  You will be confident that you will quiet privacy and an outstanding complimentary breakfast along with a small quiet restaurant setting as needed for dinner.  The rates are reasonable and you will be very satisfied-15 min. to beaches. The staff has always been great. "Happy trails to you."  Carole Nelson

The room was clean, and in good condition, bed was really good for a good sleep the room was big with a walk in closet, it as a ministore on the lobby with candy, soda, and a little extra, the breakfast was decent on both days, very friendly staff

This is one of the nicest hotels, Best Western Plus was a wonderful surprise. We asked for a room close to the Lobby, got the closest one to it. Bottled water and snacks complementary in room, delicious cookies at the desk late after. Our room very spacious, very clean, most of the staff so courteous. People at the Front desk nice but several of the young men should learn to smile like the young ladies do! Breakfast was included, right across the driveway, everything delicious and a very good selection. Liked the fact  that they wanted to seat you, something a few customers did not seem to realise. Great experience, would definitely stay here again, good central location for Orange County.

We stayed here just for one night so we had a closer drive to the Catalina Flyer the next morning. The check in was easy. Room was clean and quiet. Beds were comfy. Pool was small ,but suited our needs. Overall was good for us.

Summary Heading: Not that great of a place for the money
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights as we were visiting the area from out of state. The rooms were clean but the internet was very very slow and the hair blower/dryer didn't always work. We were not happy with the continental breakfast. Didn't have much of a variety as other hotels do. Not that great of a place for the money.

best hotel for access to Orange county fair and swap meet. and Newport beach area. for fine ding. We stayed four nights and we were upgraded to a 'suite' although it didn't have a separate lounge area. Staff helpful but lacked knowledge of local area especially the hours for the orange county swap meet that happens every Saturday and Sunday starting at 7:00 AM through 4:30 PM.

Nice, clean property at a good rate. Friendly staff. Restaurant on-site, swimming pool & (indoor) jacuzzi, fitness room, complimentary breakfast. Short taxi ride into Newport Beach; also very close to the OC Fair grounds.

Stayed here on a recent trip evaluating colleges with my daughter.  Room was clean and comfortable and seemed relatively up to date. Had 2 queens and the beds were also comfortable. The A/C was a little noisy.  Nice to finally have a tv in the room where the guide on the remote actually brings up a guide with the programming. Shower head  was not the best.  Breakfast was ok.  I don't think the OJ from the dispenser was real juice even though it said so. There could be a better selection of fresh fruit, all they had was whole apples. Meat and egg dish of the day is pre-determined.  The one bright spot to breakfast was the make you own waffles. The gym is a joke.  Such a small room that if more than one person was using it you would bump into the other.

We were very pleased with our stay at the Best Western Plus in Costa Mesa, Ca.  It is in a good location for going to Newport Beach.  The rooms are very nice and one of the best breakfast bars we have been to in our travels.  Would highly recommend.  We really didn't have any problems or concerns at this location.

Summary Heading: Room was a bit dated and all round it did not live up to Best Western Plus standards.
Summary: I stayed the one night at this hotel whilst on business in the Irvine area of South California and I wasn't impressed with my stay at all.  As a Best Western Diamond Rewards Card Holder I stay at a lot of Best Western Hotels both in the USA and globally and I book them both direct with the B.W. website and also indirectly using Booking.com and I have always received my reward points and been treated very well as a regular Best Western customer.  On checking in at the Newport Mesa Inn I was told that I wouldn't be getting any reward points as I'd booked on Booking.com and therefore I wasn't entitled to the Diamond Cardholder benefits.  Now my view is that the rewards are for loyalty to the Best Western Brand and I was staying at a Best Western Hotel and that should be the end of
Manager Response: Dear Robert,   I would like to let you know that as a courtesy I have posted your BW Gold crown points for a night you stayed with us. I recommend to make booking through Best Western web site therefore, there will be no problem in the future.   If you have any question please let me know. You can contact me at  949 650 3020   We always value you business , hope to see you again.   Sincerely,  Naj Ekhlas  General Manager  Best Western Plus Newport Mesa Hotel

Summary: A good value for a great night in a great room. No noise at night, good bedding, great choice for breakfast. I was really please for the price I paid to have all that offered. I am not difficult by I really enjoy a good mattress and no noise at night.

Summary Heading: Costa Mesa BW gets our thumbs up
Summary: Had a great stay while in LA area for son's graduation from UC Irvine.  BW staff were generally great to work with, accommodations clean and quiet.  Breakfast definitely filled our needs as did Internet.  Would stay here again.

Excellent Best Western.  Breakfast was good, rooms were quiet and very nice. We would definitely stay here again if we are visiting the Newport area. No problems at this hotel. Close to freeway and beach

I stayed at this property for it's location to the MusINK festival at the Orange County Fairgrounds in mid-March. The Fairgrounds are right across the freeway from the hotel. We checked in fairly late at about 1am and were greeted by a friendly front desk host and had no problem getting into our room. The room was much larger than expected and the free waters and snacks were a nice surprise. Everything was clean and modern. Our room was at the back of the building, so we didn't experience any noise, however I suggest you bring earplugs in case of possible noise from the parking lot or service road. There is an Italian restaurant on-site (didn't try it),  two convenience stores/gas stations nearby and a small diner further down the block (good for breakfast or lunch), but nothing

We have come to expect hotels along the lines of Best Western to be, more or less, a place to stow our stuff and rest our heads when away from home.  We don't equate it to being anything near a resort.  What we found was a warm welcome, clean, well kept facilities and helpful, friendly staff.  The welcome basket in the room was definitely a plus!  No issues with loud neighbors, broken tiles or equipment, or stray hairs from the previous tenant. We would highly recommend this location and would gladly return.

Clean.  Pillows upon pillows which is always a plus.  Free breakfast.  Missed a star because housekeeping comes banging on the door way too early.  Front desk people were friendly enough.  Make sure to book on your phone or laptop prior to going in.  They will NOT give you the lowest price.

Once you get on the property, you are not disappointed. Since we are Platimum Members we were given an upgrade to the top floor. It was pleasant. We'd go back again.   The same day we arrived , we went down to Newport Beach, Balboa Island, Fashion Island. Everything is just a Hop, Skip and a Jump Away!  The Staff is very helpful.

I wish the room cost was a little lower for senior citizens with a Platinum card.  SUGGESTION: Rooms for slightly handicapped guests should be available - specifically a walk-in shower with just a 4 inch edge/lip to lift one's feet over.  I found that getting in and out of the 12 inch side of a tub is somewhat inhibiting for myself and those who also may be using a walker or a wheelchair to get around. In the meantime, an attached rod to grip on to when getting in and out would also be very helpful in rooms that only have a tub enclosure.  Thank you & best wishes, Carole Nelson

went to meet my granddaughter, great grand daughter, they live in Washington state so don't get to see them as often as We would like. They were staying at the same hotel and since we are members it only seemed right.  Hotel was an exceptional place close to air ports, easy to find, and good breakfast.  Rooms were lovely, also not far from Balboa Island , Newport Beach, and all the amenities that go with luxurious, Beach Cities.  Had a wonderful time.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel for the price and location
Summary: This was a return trip for me. Quality of room and the location I need made this hotel a must. It is a great hotel if you need to be near the airport, Orange Coast College, or Fairgrounds. On freeway.

Friendly experienced staff - Great breakfast - clean well kept hotel.  We highly recommend  this hotel for both business and family travel.  This hotel is located in Costa Mesa near Newport Beach, with easy access to the freeway.

I was in Costa Mesa for a conference and stayed here for 3 days.   The rooms was clean, quiet & well stocked.   The breakfast was good and the staff was very accommodating.  Will still here again next year!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel next to the OC Fair
Summary: Stayed here for the OC Half Marathon which has some major issues exiting the area once you have finished. Chose this one because it is walking distance to the race and I could use my points. Very nice staff and comfy clean rooms. Breakfast was not the best Best Western I have had and for a PLus hotel it could have been better. Small issue with homeless people hanging out in the parking lot but otherwise very satisfied with the stay

I stayed at the Best Western for a conference in the area.  Overall, I was happy with the property, it was clean and comfortable.  The breakfast was okay, it could have been better.  The beds were very comfortable.  It is not anything fancy, but it was nice for this trip.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, nice warm pool. Great employees.
Summary: We got a great deal on a 2 queen bed room.  Room was dated but clean. It honestly had the best TV service out of 6 different hotel stays on our California trip, including 2 luxury hotels. If TV matters to you.... The pool was refreshing, warm, and a good size. Hotel staff was excellent. We didn't have the complimentary Full Breakfast at the neighboring cafe, but it seemed to look pretty decent with many options. Great hotel next to SNA Airport.

room was good for value. service rep was horrible. For some reason he had an attitude and was extremly rude to me. made us was forever to checkin and was always having some problem. would stay at bestwestern again, but never this one.

We had a last minute trip to visit our son. He flew in from Austin for a job interview. Compared to other hotels in the area this was the best price 100.00 military rate King bed comfortable btw and let me add the reception was friendly upgraded us which was very nice. Room was clean and nice flat screen tv. Parking for our room we were told to park under ground which was creepy only because when we first went down there it was dark but it was during the day and we took our son to an Angel game which was about 30 south of the hotel with traffic. Parking was free another surprise. Free breakfast but we didn't try it. We will stay again if in the area. Happy and safe travels.

Was here to visit son in Irvine, had wonderful stay. Location close to most SO Cal sights. Food was very good, staff always friendly and helpful.  In room amenities good, coffee, tea, refrigerator, internet, tv. Pool area small but very comfortable, nice place to relax. Very happy with this experience at BW Plus.

My room was fantastic. Very clean, complementary snack basket, very nice staff. My complaints are as follows: the shower was awful, just kind of spit water in your general direction everything in the exercise room is broken  the breakfast is terrible  that being said, very quiet and clean. I slept well and enjoyed my stay. I do hope that they look into the problems and do some upkeep.

We received an complimentary upgrade when we checked in. The hospitality staff was amazing. Brought us more towels without even asking because of the number iof people in our party. The room was spacious, immaculate, and comfortable. The breakfast was a full breakfast with vegetarian options. We really enjoyed our stay and will return. Our room was on the top floor towards the back which helped reduce the street noise. We will return for sure!

I don't know what you want me to say, I value my time and I don't like being pressured to give reviews. I already told you, my stay at the Best Western was very pleasant and I enjoyed it very much, now please leave me alone.

We found this Best Western to be one of the best we've stayed in.  The value for what we paid was excellent, as was the quality of the facility and employees.  The breakfast was good, and there was a good variety.

for our purposes, this was a good hotel. too bad the coffee in lobby wasn't that great tho. but a good location- right off the freeway and near the ocean. be sure to take names of the good staff to give kudos to later!

Summary Heading: Great stopover spot near John Wayne Airport
Summary: We needed a hotel for one night before a morning flight out of SNA. I'm so happy we selected this spot. The rooms were spotless, friendly service and a great breakfast in the morning. There's a free shuttle to the airport, which was a ten minute ride. There is no full service restaurant nearby, but three or four close fast food choices. We ate at the Cabo Grill, which was tiny but good Mexican food.

This hotel is amazing! We had a flight cancelled and lucked into staying here!  It has the most amazing, accommodating staff I have ever experienced. They picked us up  at the airport, suggested places to visit, and got us a rental car. The rooms are amazingly clean. A basket of goodies await you and they bring you whatever you need!  The breakfast was delicious and fresh. I just can't say enough about this hotel. I promise you will not be sorry! (Price is great also!)

This hotel is very clean & well kept. The staff were all very accommodating & friendly. I have stayed here before & will again when I am in the area. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. The breakfast was very good & they offered a wide variety of items.

This hotel has a very nice lobby.  We requested a microwave, but didn't have one in our room which we ended up not needing.  Internet access very easy to log-on onto.  Ample supplies of toiletries.  The hot breakfast selection was surprising and good (two varieties of egg dishes).  The coffee should be marked "Regular or Decaf".  We did not use the pool/fitness room.  The location worked out conveniently for us.  Very quiet, did not hear any next door guests.  We will strongly consider staying here again.

Summary Heading: Caring staff and great customer service
Summary: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor and there were many good reviews. The staff was attentive, polite and respectful. I went into the cafe late at night because I wanted to buy a glass of milk (I like to have a glass of milk before bed) and the young man working there gave me a glass a milk, for no charge.  The place was clean and quiet.  It looked like they were in the process of spiffing the place up.  Also, they provided apples, 2 bottles of water, a bag of chips and a couple granola bars, which were complimentary.  I'm always afraid to open food provided in hotel rooms because you might be charged for it, but they assured me it was free.  Very nice!

best western advertises wireless but does not offer, resetting router does not help, no one did anything to help a business man do business, the room and renovation were fine, location fair, on highway 55 when you are looking for it, many hotels have mastered offering wireless internet, i suggest you try them

I needed some computer help in their Business Center and Cody (without being asked) came right over and fixed it. Mary was awesome for trying several times to get a fax through for me. Everyone there was super, but these two stand out!

The hotel I was going to stay at for my conference (Hilton) was booked and I ended up at the Best Western Plus instead.  Kind of glad it worked out that way as there was free underground parking, and free breakfast/wifi for about half the price of the Crowne Plaza which would have been across the street from the Hilton.  It only took about 5 to 7 minutes to drive from here to the Hilton and getting in and out was easier.    Check in was fast, easy and efficient and the breakfast was good. I was upgraded to a 3rd floor room which included some extra perks.  The room was extremely spacious and included a comfy recliner and an assortment of free water and snacks.  The flaming cheetos was an odd choice but I don't judge!  The apples were kind of mushy too but it was still a nice

Close to the beach, and the Crab Cooker!  Hotel was clean and staff was great!  Has a heated outdoor pool and indoor hot tub.  Room was plenty big with coffee maker, fridge, flat screen TV with free on demand and a full hot breakfast.  It was a great overall stay and we will definitely be back!

Summary Heading: Getting what you expect at a hotel
Summary: We arrived a little later than we had planned. We were hungry and tired. We were greeted at the front desk with compassion. We were given a nice room with a parking spot close to the door.  We could have parked below the hotel in a covered parking area.  The hotel had a small store to purchase the needs we may have forgotten. A hot tray of chocolate chip cookies or oatmeal cookies was brought out for us. The hotel seemed to be full but I was not sure. Every morning of our stay we had a different style of eggs as well as beacon or sausage. The newly remodeled bath area had a tub large enough to float in.

THis hotel is well-managed.  Thye personel are friendly and helpful.  The rooms were spacious.  We were pleasantly surprised by a complimentary basket full of snacks.  The area offers so much to see and do.  :We will be back.

The staff was nice and check in was smooth. Room was clean with free internet with a fridge in the room. There was cookies in the evening if you wanted one and they were warm. A nice touch to do. The breakfast was good and included with the room. It was in another building just across from the main hotel. We ate dinner there also and the food was good. Breakfast was pretty good with choices of eggs and or Cereal or muffins and other breakfast items. We have service dogs and everyone on staff were great. Its not walking distance to Balboa Newport Beach but not to far from it in a car. We would return again. The beds are ok but not the best for back issues. Might need to do a check on their beds for newer ones I'd say maybe need to replace or in this room we had. It was quiet

Best Western Newport Beach hands down is the nicest Hotel in Costa Mesa. Rooms, all very clean an upgraded. To the free warm breakfast (Free) Dinner for a fee on the same dining room. Great dinners are also served in the same dinning area. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the Manager there is a great Man. He's helpful and understanding. Their salads and dinners are very good. It's so clean, and everything always runs smooth. like I said....If you need anything...Just ask. It's by far the best place to stay in Costa Mesa Hands Down....

very clean, nice looking, good services, we were very satisfied with our stay and all of the employees. thank you, we are looking to stay at this hotels again whenever we are coming down visiting our relatives in LA.

This hotel presents an excellent range of services and amenities for the price. While not walking distance to most dining and stores it is a very short drive to the beach and fine dining with views of Newport Bay. Rooms are very comfortable and large. Beds are comfortable. Rooms are fresh ans clean and nicely appointed with a desk, small table, more than enough room and a nice split bathroom. I stayed at this hotel last year for business and returned for these reasons.

Summary Heading: Good deal if in Newport Beach
Summary: Well appointed rooms and a staff that aims to please.  Location is good, near freeways and restaurants.  Nice full breakfast included.  Some rooms have two sinks which is nice.  Computers available for guest use, coffee/tea 24/7.  There is a pool, Jacuzzi and some exercise equipment as well.

Stayed during Christmas holidays: room very clean; bed comfortable although pillows were a little bit uncomfortable for us.  Personnel at hotel friendly and accommodating, room had a complimentary basket, room was spacious, large flat screen television. Hotel very quiet and easy access to freeway and South Coast Plaza and beach.  Breakfast was good , overall great stay will definitely make this our home away from home, already recommended to others.

Summary Heading: Very clean, centrally located nice Hotel!!
Summary: My family of four stayed three nights here and we will definitely be back! The service staff was very friendly - from the front counter staff, to the house keeping staff, to the staff that over saw the breakfast. The room was very clean, beds comfortable, breakfast was good. You could tell the Hotel was older, but it looks like its been remodeled...even caught the house keeping staff scrubbing the walls in the hallways...there is a seating area/loft/gathering room on the 2nd floor with a TV and restroom which we used and loved! The location was great for getting to the beach or to Balboa Island...or freeways etc etc. We will definitely be back!

Good breakfast, free wi-fi, friendly service.  Reserved King room, was given 2 Queens.  Toilet clogged, asked for room change.  Was given King room.  Toilet clogged again.  Not luxury, but, good value for price.

Recently stayed at this location. It was actually a nice place to stay. A pet peeve I have with hotels is how they skimp on the towels (especially when two are in the room) but they were quite generous with 4 bath towels and a number of hand towels. They also provided two of every bathroom amenity. A nice touch was the two bottles of water, apples, granola bars and small bag of chips. Some challenges checking in but all was handled.   Pros: Easy free parking, clean room, free water/snacks and plenty of amenities in the room, free wi-fi, decent sized room, towels, location just off the 55 freeway Cons: It rained and I could hear the dripping all night (3rd floor on the end), planes landing until 10pm on the backside of the hotel, breakfast buffet was barely adequate, on a one way

This is a renovated classic highway motor inn that has added elements usually reserved for larger city hotels. The freshly baked cookies upon check in and Oxygen brand toiletries were a welcome surprise. The room provided a coffee maker, bar fridge and complimentary water, apple and granola bar. The in-room safe was large enough for your laptop and the flat screen TV was a decent size. The real surprise was a La-Z-Boy recliner - not something you would expect in your motel room. The hot breakfast was more than adequate and I highly recommend making yourself a waffle. It is located right next to the on-ramp for the highway to the airport and extremely convenient, but you need a car. This is not an area for walking around.

our stay was very nice The hotel is clean and quiet, staff is great. We are looking for a home away from home to visit our daughter. the breakfast is very good.  will probably return very soon. There is a lot to see in the area

Stayed here for business and enjoyed stay.  Much better than the hell hole I stayed at in Irvine Spectrum at the "Quality Inn".  This place is heaven compared.  Great cookies, bathroom items, and acceptable morning breakfast, nice staff.

We visited Crystal Cove State Park, Newport Beach and the LDS Temple in Newport.  This hotel was a great location for each.  Easy to find and close to the freeway without freeway noise.  The rooms were very nice and extremely clean.  The breakfast was better than most and added to the value of the room.  We also enjoyed the pool.  The staff and service was excellent.  They were able to answer our questions and provided driving directions more than once.  Would definitely stay here again.

Staff decided 730am is a good time to vacuum the hallway in from of our room. Shortly after the hammering and sawing started. When I called the front desk they informed me I was a liar. They infoed me that housekeeping doesn't arrive until 8am so I imagined the vacuum, and there is no construction only "maintenance" which didn't start until 9am. Which also included cutting holes in the ceiling. So apparently I hallucinated all the noise and the times I saw on the clock. They were completely unapologetic and could care less about my rest being ruined. This is what I get for wanting a bargain. Will NEVER stay at a best western again.

This is a clean and comfortable hotel.  For the price you can't beat it in this area.  The neighborhood is not the best, but good enough given the convenient location.  One of only a few hotels in the area that offers free parking.  Would definitely stay here again.

Good hotel property.  Friendly staff.  Clean room. Good amenities.  Would recommend to others without hesitation and would stay here if returning to the area. This review requires 200 characters, so here are the additional ones required- which is offensive- that's how picky I am- zero rating to Trip Advisor for making a ridiculous word count requirement like this!

Good hotel, good services, near the beaches, near to my office, near to shopping malls, breakfast included, typical american standard, will stay here again next time if possible, parking garage available,

We stayed 2 nights in October. Breakfast was included, much better than an average Best Western breakfast. A welcome basket in the room (water, fruit snacks) was a pleasant surprise. We had a spacy, clean, comfortable room with 2 queen beds. The best was the level of service - really helpful and attentive personnel. Special thanks to Naj Ekhias, the General Manager. His personal engagement and dedication a rare quality which we really appreciated. We are more used to a polite and rather impersonal service with the usual "have a nice day". When a manager says to you (after the check-out): "Please, keep your things at my office as long as you want", goes personally to see you off and gives you a bottle of water when you leave you know that you will come back.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay in Newport Area
Summary: Always stay here when travelling to the area, staff are friendly, rooms are spacious and clean, and prices are reasonable, so what else could one ask for?  Easy Access to interstates from here which in LA traffic is very handy for any business traveller...

Staff was friendly and accommodating. Room was nice. Breakfast was good. Best Western is the largest hotel chain in the world.  You can almost always find a Best Western at any destination.  I like to stick with one chain in order to build up maximum points.  I have always had good experiences with Best Western.

Brought three 90 + family members to visit their older brother.  All of the staff we encountered were helpful and pleasant.  Rooms were clean, and beds were very comfortable.  Nice heated pool for a late night swim.  It was also conveniently located for visiting their family and seeing some of the costal sights.

Summary Heading: A Great time at a lovely place
Summary: We arrived on Monday 10/27/14 at this Best Western Plus and we will return again. The people are pleasant, always smiling and asking if they could do anything for us.  The accommodations were great, the room was perfect.  The General Manager Naj Ekhias, and his staff, Cody, Mary at the front desk were so nice.  They had full breakfast, across from the lobby and it was just so great,there was Jammie, Parker and all the people I did not get to ask their name, they were great.  I will tell friends in Phoenix, if they need to visit this part of California, this is where they should stay. Kudos to all the staff.  Jim and Angie  Phoenix, Az

Roll the dice on Costa Mesa area with Priceline on this hotel. I chose Express Deal because I did not want surprise resort fees and extra charges for parking, internet and breakfast. At check in we were told the Priceline room is the handicapped room.  They were not fully booked and the only way we could change rooms is to pay the difference. I wish I would have spent the extra $20/night somewhere else and had to pay for my own breakfast. Things are older and a bit worn. Girl at check in very friendly. Room clean so far. Later we requested a microwave and it was promptly delivered to our room.   If you are on a tight budget this works.  If you expect a little more AND 3 stars or higher, keep looking.

Stayed here for 2 nights last week while in California for a wedding.. Positives: clean, convenient and the breakfast options were plentiful.Negatives: spotty wi-fi which was a HUGE issue since I had school work to attend to - I had called the front desk and was told they would reset the modem but that did not help.
