We had to walk around the room with an IPAD till we found the strongest signal and that is where I sat with my computer on my lap to do work. One of the mornings there were very noisy children who were running up and down the hallway at 6:00am.Really?? Where were the parents..sleeping?

We selected this hotel for our first and last night as it is close to JWAirport.  The room was very nice, clean and great bed.  There was a welcome gift of fruit/nuts and water.  Very quiet and comfortable after and before a long day of travel.  They upgraded us for our last nite and that was very nice!

Stayed here recently when attending a conference at the Hilton Orange County.  I was very pleased with the quality of the spacious room which included a king size bed, dresser,  sofa, coffee table, desk and chair.  There was a large bathroom area with a walk-in closet and larger than usual fridge.  The location was quiet but conveniently located for access to the freeway.  The room was very clean.  The included breakfast was, well, meh.  Hot items were available (scrambled eggs, breakfast meat); the DIY waffle was pretty good.  Various cereals breads and fruit were available as well.  It was convenient, especially as my days at the conference started pretty early.  There are many excellent restaurants in the area and Huntington Beach is a short drive away.

The hotel had a reasonable rate, but it was much nicer than I anticipated; it was clean, excellent service, competent staff and  our 2 day stay was  a pleasure. When we had a problem and our rental car broke down the staff was extra helpful in keeping the car and getting us a taxi so that we did not miss our important meeting.  They took care of everything, as we had to leave from the conference in order to fly back hom.  I was in toukch with them several times that day by phone and each staff member I spoke with could update me on the progress of the problem car.  However, they also were helpful and excellent prior to the car problem.  I would recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Don't be deceived by the exterior of this hotel. The interior is perfectly lovely, the rooms are nicely equipped and CLEAN!! The beds are wonderfully comfortable. Additionally - the pool, hot tub and fitness center are a nice touch.

nice big tub in the King suite w/Jacuzzi.  I upgraded to the King suite with an ajoining room.  This was a great set up for my friend and myself.  Might stay here again.  close to beaches and shopping.  easy to get to, nice area and nice warm heated pool

All the rooms have everything granite tops from bathrooms to tables to desks.  Always very clean.  They greet you with water, and healthy snacks in the room. Only issue I have is that the walls are thin and I am always hearing X-rated stuff and the pool can be a little cleaner.

I stayed here for one night due to an early morning class.  Very nice room.  I had everything I needed, including a room upgrade!  The breakfast was good.  I slept well, which is not easy in a hotel sometimes!

The room was very clean and comfortable.  It was appointed well The staff was friendly and helpful and cheerful.  Breakfast gave a good variety of items.  The location is great, not beautiful but close to the Mall and other amenities.

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  We were there 7 nights and the room was quiet, the maids and front desk were very helpful, the free breakfasts in the restaurant were excellent!  When we go back to visit our son in a couple of years, we will definitely stay there again.

The hotel staff and management were all very helpful and kind. The breakfast was very good and rooms were very clean. Staff worked very hard to ensure a pleasant stay. Pool and fitness center were a plus. Would recommend to all.

Our stay at the Best Western PLUS Newport Mesa Inn was very comfortable and relaxing. We had no problem parking our car and access to the Hotel was easy and secure. The location fit our needs perfectly.

Summary Heading: Expected more from Best Western Plus
Summary: My family gets together once a year to spend time at Newport and Huntington Beach. We have been staying at a favorite Best Western  in this area, in the past, but no rooms were available for the time we needed ,and decided to try this one. It was just not the quality that we have come to expect from  Best Western in service and cleanliness. We were disappointed.  Will not stay again.

Hotel staff was too busy playing with personal tablet to take care of my concerns, ice machines broken and glass was in the hallway. The room was not clean with mold in the soap dish in the bath tub.  I was extremely tired after a long day and was not expecting such a terrible stay. I probably would have enjoyed a Motel 8 night better than this hotel.

Very impressed with the level of service and personnel attention and dedication.  Incredible value, great location,   modern and warrm decor, will definitely stay there again.  My husband and I had a marvelous time at this property.

Nice hotel very close to John Wayne airport. Breakfast included, the usual. There is a 24 hour Jack in the box on the corner if you need a late night meal. But lots of restaurants close by and the beaches. Large room. Had 2 queen beds. And they left a welcome basket with a couple of waters, apples and granola bars. Sweet! Would recommend and stay here again for the OC area beaches and airport. They do have a small pool and gym. It does see. Like an older hotel but rooms look remodeled and nice. Will try to add pics.

Staff was very friendly and very courteous. Had chocolate chip cookies available for guests checking in. Really good touch, especially with our kids. Rooms were spacious, a little outdated but very comfortable. TV on the other hand was a 32", which was probably just a tad too small for our big room.  Staff was acknowledging us as we were walking the halls.  Breakfast was free the next morning. Pool and jacuzzi were also nice.  I would stay again.

I use this hotel every 3 months or so to visit grandkids.  The beds are comfortable and the room are spacious.  The hotel has easy access to freeway; it is nearby gas stations and fairly close to the beach.  This trip I noticed that they had enlarged the dining area which was very nice.  The room also had a complimentary water and snack basket which had not been there before.  Parking is available on site without extra fees, however, is a little small.

Been here a few times now and again cannot stop giving it praises. Pretty busy because of their fair but quality didn't suffer. Love the weekend staff here. Every time I have come in Mary and Cody give a warm welcome and always check me in early.  Breakfast was just as it has been since my first stay here, set apart from other hotels.   Thinking of referring my company to this hotel for business stays. Again keep up the great work!

Overall very nice hotel.  Enjoyed a great weekend, until checkout. As i was checking out the clerk asked if I rode a motorcycle and I said yes. He said, well you parked very close to my car, as I said, first off, there was plenty of room, and second you were taking up 2 spaces.  He then tells me, that is a no parking zone and its for employees only.  I just stared at him and dropped it.  After going out to my bike, I look for signs.  the three spaces to the left had signs and the one I was in had one as well, except that the overgrown tree was blocking it, and you really had to look to see it.  Bottom line, it left a sour taste in my mouth when I left and all could of been avoided with no comment. So the "Biker Friendly" advertisement on the web page is not too accurate.

I was happy with the motel when we pulled up to it but my opinion quickly turned around after checking in. I was met with registration desk that must have been having a bad day as they messed up on my reservations that I had booked months in advance and even had a confirmation number.  I ended up getting to my room only to find my bathroom was not properly cleaned and there were little signs of old tenants all over the floor leading me to believe they didn't even vaccuum.  I would recommend future travelers look at other options around the Costa Mesa area before they book with the Best Western

In town visiting family from the Midwest so I don't have the highest standards however the cleanliness of the room was unacceptable at best. I asked the front desk to send someone up and I waited and waited with no response. Staff is not concerned for the welfare of the guest. Sad to say I won't be back....

Summary Heading: I thought it was worth the price
Summary: I thought the hotel was really nice.   But most of all the restaurant was one of the best hotel restaurants I have ever eaten at.  The breakfast was very good and the employees where so helpful and kind.

Stayed here with my wife. Location is great. Downside: - very stuffy room with no window - very loud, hear neighbors talking clearly all night - very small rooms - lots of other complaining about smoke smell in rooms
Manager Response: Dear Sir:  Using hearsay to place a negative review is not  acceptable. All our guest rooms have a large window and the room size is large in comparison to most hotels.   Sincerely,  Management

Summary: Pro's:  Convenient, looks and feels like an upgraded Best Western, good amount of parking, good treatment of BW Honors status.  Con's:  Internet could be faster, even though it's in a restaurant, breakfast is pretty typical BW fare

This is a great hotel for staying with your family. It is nice, clean and well cared for. The kids love the pool. It is close to many attractions in Orange County and offers a great price for traveling families

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Best Wester Plus Newport Mesa Inn
Summary: Great service, really good breakfast, extremely helpful staff, from the front desk, to the housekeepping, and engineers.  Reported an outage and it was fixed within minutes.  Would definitely recommend!

the overall motel is very good.recommend you take a laptop as they have dsl,their wifi leaves something to desire.close to the beaches,reasonably priced and the staff was very helpful.The restaurants in the area are all within easy driving distance. within walking distance of the fair grounds

We knew we'd get a decent place to stay with Best Western, but we were in a pinch and they not only came through, the hotel far exceeded our expectations.  Good location, spacious rooms and a 50 inch High Def. TV with all the sports, news and HBO channels.  Best Western Plus of Newport is now at the top of our list when we need to stay overnight in the area.

What a wonderful stay.  The staff knew that this visit was a special occasion and added to our stay with a surprise. The bed was so comfortable.  The jacuzzi worked great.  The room had everything we needed.  I think we will stay again next year.

Just loved everything about this place Kelly, cody, mary, edris, khaled and naj are the best team of guest services representatives I have ever met in my 20+ years of hotel stays.   The breakfast staff is amazing as well. Jason really brightened my mornings up with juicy celeb gossip and solid customer service. Can't say I've had a better complimentary breakfast; fresh eggs, bacon and warm pastries. Full coffee bar was the kicker. Great quality.  Had to give credit where its due to this shining example of how a hotel should be operated.  -prompt airport pick up -flexible rooming accommodations, i was upgraded by the manager -knowledgeable staff; mary recommended a close beach for the kids and cody gave us a great restaurant to check out  that was kid friendly  -wake-up calls

everything was good on this hotel for sure I come back wen I get may vacations again and sure am recommend it the best western hotel for other people. its close to the Newport beach and many stores in the area.

my husband and I had another excellent experience staying at a Best Western hotel. This time we spent three weeks on business at the west coast. Our prior stay was at the Miami International airport Plus hotel. The hotel rooms were impeccably clean and comfortable.  A varied hot and cold breakfast is included. Hotel staff in Newport Beach shared the same friendliness of the Miami Best Western hotel.

My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during a recent trip to LA and area. It had great accessibility to major freeways, trips to the beach and shopping of course!  With the hot breakfast included, a clean, roomy and renovated accommodation, it was fantastic value for the price! Would absolutely stay there again!

The hotel was very clean and very nice, and the rooms were updated large and very welcoming. The 55 freeway entrance is right across the exit from this hotel, so it makes it nice to just hop on the 55 to go towards Disneyland, or to the 405 freeway.  Go the other direction, and you are at the beach. The staff was great, and the free breakfast was pretty tasty. Usually I stay in cheap places since I'm a single guy, but for the $15 a night difference that I paid compared to a Motel 6 or Super 8 in Westminster, it was well worth it. Highly recommended. If you don't like this place, then you have issues.

This is a very nice property away from all the congestion of Newport yet only minutes away. Very spacious rooms with very nice furnishings. The beds are so comfortable and the large flat screen was appreciated in the evenings. In room safe is a bonus as well. The entire staff is very pleasant. We will come  back again.

We traveled here for a Graduation Party,  the Hotel was clean the staff was very accommodating.  The rooms were comfortable. Nice swim area plenty of parking. The Breakfast was good many choices.  Close walking distance to restaurants.  I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: What a Surprise - Our stay June 15 - 20, 2014
Summary: Booked the hotel based on price, location (proximity to beach) and other reviews. Tend not to believe all I see in reviews, but they were good enough for me to book the hotel. The hotel looked newly remodeled. Everything was fresh in appearance, clean, and inviting. The heated pool, spa and Gym facilities were 1st rate. All equipment looked new and well maintained. The Spa is enclosed and adjacent to the pool. Hours were 9AM to 10PM. Only negative -- no pool towels down by the pool. While on the subject of towels, the only other negative I could come up with, was the small size of the bath towels.   This leads in to the rooms... we had a King Room, with refrigerator and Microwave (on request). It also had a full size sofa, walk in closet, 6 dresser drawers, and the toilet and

The Staff and the room were great. There was complimentary coffee available in the lobby 24/7 and lots of odds and ends available in the lobby too. They have recently added a cafe to be part of the motel. They serve the hot part of the breakfast and there was a nice variety of cold food and coffees. It's also an independent cafe that serves lunch and dinner. They will deliver it to the room also. It's wonderful! The pool was wonderfully warm too.

Summary Heading: Close to downtown Huntington Beach.  15 -20Mins away
Summary: Perfect location, it is close to everything.  The swap meet is directly across the street.  Plenty of places to eat close by.  friendly staff, clean rooms. Breakfast was ok.  eggs were a little dry.  Waffles were awesome.  Everything was good except shower head in our room was not good.  They need to replace and upgrade them.   Walls are a bit thin.  Could hear the neighbors a bit.

My stay was excellent. The room was very nice as well as the bed. I would recommend this hotel. The parking is very tight for SUV's. the pool is also heated. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: High end of Best Western Brand
Summary: I have stayed at several hotels in this area and this ranked up there with the Radisson which costs twice the price.  Customer service was professional and courteous.  Got a complementary upgrade to business class (not sure why but it was nice). Bedding was clean and very comfortable.  Looked recently renovated.  Convenient location for Newport Beach area.  Jacuzzi was hot and clean.   Breakfast was above par for this level chain!

My daughter,granddaughter and I stayed here while visiting friends and seeing a play at the Laguna Playhouse. We enjoyed our stay very much.The room was good, the pool was small but very nice and warm and the  hot breakfast was excellent. Also loved the cookies in the lobby. Would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: bad customer service and cancellation policies
Summary: Let me start by saying that I do not enjoy writing negative reviews,  most reviews that I write are 4-5 stars. With that said, here we go.     I booked a room at the Best Western in Costa Mesa for a trade show due to its proximity the venue that I would be attending in May 2014. A week before the event some plans changed, so I called the Best Western to cancel the reservations. They informed me of their 7 day cancelation policy, and as a result they would not be able to cancel the first night, but I could cancel the second. So, I asked to cancel the night. I was instructed to call the corporate headquarters to complete my refund. Due to the fact that the first night was not cancellable, my brother used the hotel room for the night and checked out the next morning. He was also

Stayed on business a couple of times, hotel is just at the end of the 55 freeway and a little confusing to get into because of the one-way streets around there. It's near the Fairgrounds and also quick to drive to the Beach. Rooms were clean and tidy and breakfast was fine. I would stay here again next time I am in the area. It's near to OC Airport and also South Coast Plaza.

This was a great hotel. Very clean, friendly staff, nice pool.  The rooms was large and amazing with a bar area, granite counters.  Loved this place and it was central to many locations and close to the beach-5/1- min drive.

Everyone was polite, helpful, and pleasant. All areas were clean. Pool and spa were perfect temperatures and very enjoyable. Remodeling was almost done and not noisy at all. Would stay again and again.

This hotel exceeded my expectations.  We have stayed at several hotels in the area, and are always booking with cost in mind as well as comfort.  This hotel was very clean and quite attractive and updated.  The room was large, tastefully decorated and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. Breakfast is included and was a full-course meal in a nice "cafe" atmosphere.  Great value for the buck!!

This was probably at least my 10th stay at the Newport Mesa Inn.  The staff was very helpful in accommodating my schedule by cleaning my room early as requested.  The location is very convenient to UC Irvine, San Joaquin Wildlife Refuge, Upper Newport Bay and other places that I frequent when I'm in the area. The only drawback to the location is that the hotel is located on a one way street which makes coming and going kind of interesting until you get used to it.

Hotel was very clean and the room was large.   The amenities were extremely nice, great bath products, the robes and slippers were a nice touch.   The hotel had ample parking and it was well lit.   The breakfast was great and the staff was very accommodating.

The hotel is recently renovated, finishing touches were being done. The rooms are large and some have extras like bathrobe, slippers and complimentary snacks and water. The breakfast has hot foods; eggs, bacon and waffles. I was able to get a last minute reservation for a good price.

We stayed here while visiting students at UCI. The hotel was nice and clean. Rooms were spacy and comfortable. Parking was available. Breakfast was a bit higher that average American type. Even if the road is close we were not disturbed. It's close and easy to go to Newport Beach, but a little more tricky to go go UCI Campus. Pictures on the webpage look a little too fancy.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel Near OC Fair Grounds
Summary: The hotel is really a nice place, clean, quiet and conveniently located to the Orange County Fair Grounds.  We really liked the hotel and will probably stay there again when we are at the Pet Expo next year.  The staff is really friendly.  The free breakfast is provided by the restaurant on the premises.  It is nice but could use maybe cooked oatmeal instead of instant (this is my preference for breakfast).  Otherwise, it was simple but nice.  The restaurant staff is also really friendly.  The one and only downside is that the smoking area is located across the entrance, near the restaurant and the smoke tends to drift in both directions.

Needed a place for a quick overnight and stumbled upon this one (thanks to reviews on Trip Advisor) Front desk quoted me a price higher than what I found on line but when I asked if they would honor the internet rate they not only met it but beat it! Room was very nice, clean, comfortable and even had complementary water bottles and snacks! A full breakfast was provided, bacon, eggs, potatoes etc. Very nice!

Great property! I stayed here for business and loved it. My room had a small fridge AND a microwave which is the way I like it. The room was very big, well appointed and stylish. I would definitely stay here again!

This hotel was a very good value.  The breakfast was very nice with plenty of room for seating and a variety of quality choices.  The room was very clean, spacious and comfortable.  We had pleasant experiences with the staff---very friendly and helpful.  We will definitely stay there again.

Very nice rooms, great breakfast with waffles, eggs, bacon etc. Very friendly staff, nice pool, spa and workout room. Not far from Newport beach. Had 3 grandkids with us ages 8,8 and 9 and they loved it!!

I'm from Australia and this was my first time visiting California. I was quite impressed with the value for money with the hotel, especially the fact that there was hot breakfast options available on the buffet. The rooms were clean, fairly modern and the housekeepers did a wonderful job every time. The only downside for me was that it wasn't located next to many shops so you had to travel for food but I found this was the case in a lot of the area. I found the quality of service at breakfast was unlike what I had experienced before, felt a bit like a cafeteria especially when the staff would sit strangers with you on a small table. The front office people were always very helpful and I appreciate their help when I left quicker than expected, they organised transport for me and

Summary Heading: I want to eat in my room but they say I can't!!!???
Summary: Amazing, how I was not able to eat the food I paid for in my room. I left the cafe anyway with my (2) Bananas, Apple and cold cereal anyway. I understand they want to block people from sharing food to others, but I was given a 1 meal entrance ticket, and taken out only enough food for me. I was stopped at the door, and they said I had to eat in the room LOL!!!! You got to be kidding me. I left and went to the front desk, and the employee followed me like I broken a huge law. LOL!!!! I still took my food up to may room where my laptop was waiting.

Had a lay over and was booked into the inn. Very clean, nice staff and good service.  This is not a upscale hotel. Will do for the overnighter.  They do provide extras in the room which was nice.  Very accommodating.  There is a shuttle to the airport but for me the driver never showed in the morning so they had to pay for my cab fare to JWA.  Neighborhood is right on busy road.  Good stay for the traveller.  We'll done staff.  Oh the breakfast is not all that great.  They were remodeling the place when I was there.

My experience with this Best Western was 100% positive.  Staff was so nice and helpful on both check-in and out.  Room was very nice and everything worked.  Will definitely stay there again. HBO is included as well as free internet.  The bath supplies included toothbrush/shave kit and a few other extra items.

Summary Heading: Best Best Western Iv ever stayed in
Summary: title says it all. I stay at a lot of hotels for work, this one was a cut above any Best Western I have stayed in. Hotel was clean the room was clean, the staff super friendly at the front desk. Breakfast area was clean. I def will stay at this location next trip to Newport Beach CA

The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable (even for a person with back trouble).  The staff was mostly helpful, especially the reservation clerk.  The hot breakfasts were great and the chef was helpful in finding a good seafood restaurant.  They make their own coffee cakes and pastries.  The homemade nightly cookies disappeared pretty fast and I never did get to taste one. The location was a little difficult to find but once you got used to the access route, it was fine.  Costa Mesa is a lot less expensive than Newport Beach and is only about 6 or 7 minutes away.

Was given ground floor room and our room looked out onto dead vegetation around our window and the back yard of the next door neighbour's radiator business. Very messy. Did not give us a very secure feeling. Our air conditioning was broken as was our shower head. When we went to pull the drawer on the cabinet open in came off in our hand. Front desk was very unaccommodating. Complimentary breakfast was good.
Manager Response: We are sorry the cabinet and scenery is unsatisfactory.  Because of your response, we are working currently renovating the side yard.  Thank you for letting us know of broken cabinetry.  Our housekeeping staff will work harder to ensure this will not happen again.  Please come back again and give us your feedback.  Thank you.

Summary: This Best Western is a favorite for us and our friends because of the quality of the rooms and service. The recently upgraded breakfast area is a major improvement and makes this location the best value in the area.

Have stayed here before - clean, conveniently hotel located (although not at beach) - rooms are relatively spacies with nice amenities - breakfast is very good and so is service - the only drawback was that I was told I couldn't change rooms from 2 beds to a single bed after credit card was run upon check in - didn't want to argue since it was only a one night stay, actually got a good nights sleep in my own bed since wife didn't kick me

Waffles, scrambled eggs, bacon, fresh fruit and good coffee exceeded my expectations!  The only thing that could make it better would be to install a cappuccino machine and to have real maple syrup rather than that corn syrup stuff.  The rooms were large and spacious.  No extra charge for parking.  Good value for the money.

Summary Heading: Very nice base for seeing Orange County nature
Summary: We recently stayed here for two nights.  The room was nice and comfortable and toward the back of the motel away from the nearby freeway so it was also quiet.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Our main reason for the trip was to attend a basketball game at the Bren Center at UCI but we stayed an extra day to go to the San Joaquin Wildlife Sanctuary and the Upper Newport Bay Nature Preserve.  This is a great place to stay to see these places as well as being only a short drive to the Bolsa Chica Wetlands. The only minor drawback is that the motel is located on a one-way street so there is a fair amount of going around the block when entering or leaving.

This is our "go to" hotel when we visit our son and grandchildren in Costa Mesa.  We can always get a room and breakfast is included.  We like the rooms in the back of the hotel actually overlooking the back parking.  Since there is plenty of parking available in the underground garage there is rarely noise from the outside lot.  The rooms are generous in size and we always find two bottles of water, fruit and granola bars awaiting us in the room.  Internet is included. Large closets and in room coffee.  If you can't agree on what TV program or movie to watch, there is another TV salon on the second floor.  The staff has been very courteous and accommodating to us over the years during our frequent visits.  We take early morning walks at the large Twinkle Park just across the

Great set up for business. Turned our room into an office and it was big enough for my husband to nap while I worked? Felt like I was back at office. Highly recommended for business.Also my husband thought it would be good for a family with kids.

Summary Heading: Great hidden treasure that's not to be skipped over!
Summary: This nice, clean, VERY AFFORDABLE hotel is tucked away off the major highways (nice perk when in LA) not in your typical hotel/motel location. Easy to find with a GPS but hidden from view if just looking for it. The hallways and room were clean and well kept. The beds were so comfortable that we didn't want to get up for our whale watching trip but then we had just flown in from Wisconsin so we were very tired. The only downside was the restaurant attached to the hotel. It was fine for breakfast but it looked like it is struggling a bit for other meals probably because of the location. We had to drive quite a bit to find a restaurant for dinner.

The exterior of the hotel is beautifully landscaped.  The lobby is large and very inviting.  Rooms are well appointed with all the amenities.  Staff is cordial, effecient and friendly.  Breakfast is included an is quite tasty.  The property is located in close proximity to the beach cities as well as all the inland attractions.  The 55 freeway is just across the street from the property making travel very convenient.

Summary Heading: a good night sleep in a good value hotel
Summary: Best westerns are pretty standard, you know what to expect, good mattresses, good service. They upgraded me on my arrival so I guess I had better accommodation than what I paid for. I like the breakfast included and usually choose to stay Best western for the points and the expectation factor

Great staff, clean rooms, competative price, what else can you ask for.  Easy to locate, gas station next lot over, multiple eating places within a mile.  Direct access to freeway.  I travel alot for work and mostly stay at Hiltons but when I'm in Orange county, this is where I stay.

Summary Heading: Lobby was Beautifully decorated for Christmas
Summary: Rooms were okay.   Desk clerk was nice.  Lobby was beautiful!  Printer was out of ink.  Breakfast was a disaster.  Room I had reserved and confirmed several times was not available at check in.  Ran out of parking spots.  Location and price is decent for a CA hotel that is close to Disney.  Otherwise, not a positive experience.

the pool is perfectly cozy for my visiting grandson and the jacuzzi is just right. nice hotel, great breakfast, lovely employees, and well located logistically the room was just right, with just the right amenities

We needed a place to crash after a bug family reunion. The location right off the freeway was a little concern because of the noise, but the freeway is below level & the Motel is well soundproofed,, so we heard no traffic untilwe heard a airliner take off about 6:30. It was all good. Very good when price considered.

Found the location through Best Western.com.  Chose based upon location and price as well as the stated rating of the hotel.  I found the amenities to be as advertised and the experience was well worth it.  I would recommend this location to others.

Chose to give this hotel another shot and was greatly surprised at the changes since my last stay.  Last minute booking with a late arrival to a very poorly dressed older man that seemed like I was wasting his time but that was the same as my last stay so I just went to sleep on the nice king sized bed and forgot about it.  Woke up to what was a great and new breakfast assortment and was actually seated by a hostess. Unfortunately I had the displeasure of catching what I assume was a boyfriend and girlfriend loudly yelling at each other in the back kitchen. Curse words galore but I have to say the food was worth it. Go for that waffle maker! Spa was drowned with chlorine but it is a hotel so I understand.  Walked up to see about a late check out and was helped by a young man

This hotel is conveniently located next to the county fairgrounds in Costa Mesa and very near Vanguard University.  The room and grounds were both well-maintained.  The furniture and bedding were crisp and clean and the bathroom was spotless.  Unfortunately our room only had a desk chair and desk, no second chair or table, so it was not set up well for 2 people.  The mattress was average, a little on the hard side. The hot breakfast was just steps from the lobby and offered a decent selection of food.  The service was friendly.  Parking was somewhat limited and the area is definitely commercial, but it fit the bill for us.

I stay at this hotel on a regular basis for the last 4 years. The counter personnel know me by name and my travel habits. They have opened up rooms and given me standard pricing even when it is a busy, near full week. I enjoy the extra effort put forth by the staff and especially the morning breakfast. It is a full breakfast with a wide range of selection. The kitchen staff is even on hand in the evening for room service of several selections of dinners. They are more than fairly priced. I look forward to my stays and the high quality of service from this hotel.

The hotel was worth every penny.  They provide a 4 star experience for a 2 star price.  I have stayed at 3 different hotels in Costa Mesa and this one provides the best experience / price.  Compared to other hotels in this class, this hotel is extremely clean.  The front desk staff is wonderful and the restaurant inside the hotel has great organic food.  This hotel gives you a wonderful oatmeal soap bar and offer amenities.  Unlike other hotels in the area they did not charge a parking fee or resort fee.  Their breakfast which is complimentary provides a wonderful selection of food and they also offer some organic coffee.  The dinner at the restaurant is good.  The food is simply amazing.  Tip:  Park in the garage, you can take the elevator straight to your room.  Also executive

This is a very nice hotel for around $100/night. Nothing fancy here, just a nice, clean, comfortable hotel with convenient/free self parking, as well as free breakfast. Rooms are somewhat outdated, but everything is in good repair. Also, rooms are spacious and have all the amenities one would want(our room even had a fridge & microwave). Big flat screen TV in room as well . Finally, I really appreciate the nice lobby and interior entrance to the rooms.   I'll definitely be back to this hotel!

The room was large and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast was very tasty and the staff at the restaurant and the hotel were outstanding. I stayed here to visit family. I  would recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

The room was very clean and very pretty, a nice pool and Jacuzzi and ok breakfast, the eggs were better than most in hotel breakfast. The staff was great, but the hotel manager was a jerk, very rude, and unprofessional.  That alone would cause me not to want to stay here again.  Friendly and helpful staff is everything to me and this hotel failed on this totally.

Hotel was very nice, clean, exterior nice and clean. Lobby was very impressive. Room was the best! Bed soooo comfortable, hadnt had a good nights sleep like that in a long time, not even at home. Was a very nice getaway for us, and we picked the right spot. Dennis at the front desk was simply Polite and very very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone in the Costa Mesa area..

I grew up in Newport Beach and when I return home to visit my family I ALWAYS choose to stay in this best western.  This hotel is very reasonably priced (for the area).  It is in a great location, close to the Newport Beach peninsula.  I was initially nervous about the fact that this hotel is close to the freeway, but there is no noise from the 55 which passes close to the hotel.    The rooms are very big, well decorated and very quiet.  Each guest is welcomed with a small basket of food and water which is complementary.  The complementary breakfast is great.  We commonly find fresh fruit, eggs, pancakes, sausage, etc.  Everything you need to enjoy a good ol' American breakfast.    The people working at the hotel are really lovely, and I always found them to be helpful and

Overall, an average stay. Beautiful lobby, rooms clean and comfortable.  Had an issue with a clogged toilet, but maintenance came and fixed within a reasonable time frame. Very disappointed that spa wasn't working, no sign saying Out of Order. Also, phone in spa area wasn't working properly. Gal at Check Out said "sorry" but didn't really seem to care, kept giving excuses. With all the hotel options, I probably wouldn't stay at this again.

This hotel was actually quite pleasant.  I had their king bedroom suite which had lots of space plus sofa.  The TV could have been bigger or movable (still don't understand what's the point of sofas in hotel rooms if the TV can't be adjusted away from the bed to any other direction).  The bathroom was clean and simple with lots of bottled stuff (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, etc.).  There was a fridge and a complimentary fruit basket with water and granola bar too.    The breakfast was fine a step up from the usual Best Western continental.  Staff was friendly though I wish it was self-serve.  The on-site breakfast area is a little small though, especially if it gets busy.  Didn't use any other amenities.  The only other downside was the WIFI.  Half the nights, the internet went

Staff was very friendly, polite, and helpful.  Room was pleasant.  Bottled water, snacks, fruits were in the room to welcome us.  Prompt, free shuttle service to and from airport.  We arrived on a Sunday and there was not enough staff to drive their shuttle van to the airport to pick us up.  So they paid for a taxi to get us to the hotel.  How great was that!

This hotel has surprised me, I was a little hesitant when I saw the pictures. The staff is great!!!! The room is clean, and it is the first hotel I have found that has a recliner in it to watch TV. The location is great to fly in or out of John Wayne air port. I had to work so I way able to get room service with a glass of wine, although the choices are very limited. For the money and lacation this was a winner!!!!!!!!!!

Summary Heading: this is a quality hotel as nd u will enjoy ur stay
Summary: We booked this hotel through hot wire and were surprised it was a Best  Western! This is a new property well maintained with spacious clean modern rooms. The front desk people were friendly and helpful making suggestions for dinner and calling a cab for us. It is well located near the airport and easy access to freeways.

Summary Heading: Excellent choice & light on pocket too
Summary: Its an excellent choice for anyone who wants Star Hotel amenities in budget hotels. Excellent Rooms, good food (Breakfast) & overall good ambience. The WiFi is a little disappointment here as the connection signal is weak & drops regularly. The other drawback is the Room conectivity. The Staff is not technically adept at handling issues related to Intercom & external calls being forwarded to Rooms. The Restaurant has a good range of food served by a very good team.

Summary Heading: Clean enough to stay but not very quite
Summary: The Staff was very nice, but our room felt like it was decorated in the 70's.  All night long it sounded like kids were jumping on the beds and running in the halls.  I couldnt tell if it was coming from next door, upstairs or in our own hall.  Very annouying!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for completing the survey regarding your stay at our Hotel. On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to endure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.  I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.  Please don't hesitate to contact me directly at 949- 6503020 on you next stay to provide you  better accommodation.  Sincerely,   Naj Ekhlas General Manager Best Western Plus Newport Mesa Hotel

Summary: Stayed here four nights for water polo tournament in SoCal area. Appearance is a litte dated but don't be put off...rooms are clean and well maintained, front desk helpful and courteous.  Full breakfast was wonderful.  Hot eggs, meat, potatoes, waffles, juices, coffee, fresh fruit, cereal.  Location was a little tricky to get to.  Right across freeway from Fairgrounds.  You'll have to drive a couple of blocks to find restaurants (there isn't one on premises) but will then find plenty of choices.  Would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Very rude general manager he will rip u off yell and at u his name is Naj.
Summary: Great staff but manger is rude and I heard him twice talk to his staff like well can not say on here I have never heard someone treat there staff like that before he thinks women are just there to serve men how can this thing have this job.he over charged us in may of this year we where here as my wife's brother took his life and naj the manger knew this  $440 he charged our card on the day we left I knew I was coming bk in Sep so I would sort it out then but he would not even look at our problem all he said was dispute it with your bank so I had to call best western complaints line and¬†I couldn't believe it when the guy I talked to new naj because they have had many complaints about this rude male showverness man it was so funny when the guy rang naj he was so nice to him that

Stayed here with a wedding party and it was convient, huge rooms and decent breakfast. There are fancier places but this filled the bill for a quick trip into So Cal. My room did face the wall on the floor level but didn't feel unsafe. Nice welcome basket on arrival. All in all good value for the money.

I stayed here a couple nights last uear and it was excellent. Today I feel the same. Room is immaculate with frig and microwave/free water, snacks robe and slippers an a first/sanitized TV remote in a little bag-40 inch lcd tv-hot breakfast, very fair price highly recommended esp for biz traveler

Surprise how big and nicely decorated the room. Breakfast was okay, but had a lot of selection. 4/5 due to the view of some back alley, but really who stays in their room when there is a beach nearby. We had reserved four rooms and all of them were clean and big. I was worried that we would be so far from the beach and have a hard time finding our way, but no issues easy access to main highway. Staff members were awesome about extra towels, which comes in handy when traveling with two children under the age of four. Only other thing that I didn't like was washer and dryer was on 2nd floor, which made hallway humid.

Very lovely lobby.  Person at the front desk was welcoming.  Room was spacious and well appointed.  Amenities were great quality and generous.  In-room safe held our large laptops.  Underground parking is nice.  There's an on-site restaurant that looked nice but we got there too late to try it.  Breakfast was good but nothing special.  Scrambled eggs, bacon and hash browns were available so it had more offerings than most.  The hotel is right next to a freeway but we heard absolutely no freeway noise.  There were a couple of casual restaurants within walking distance.  We would definitely stay there again.

Great place to stay, clean friendly staff, great value for what you get you can't go wrong with this hotel, I have stayed in many hotels/motels but NONE compare to this one both in value, cleanness, and friendly staff

Stayed 2 nights 1st September. 30 minute drive from LAX and easy to find. Front desk helpful and checked us in 2 hours early (nice, thank you) Large comfortable room, clean and well appointed. Small pool area but always deserted so no probs finding a chair. Free breakfast is a plus, plenty of choice. No problems at all and would defiantly stay here again next time in OC.

Summary Heading: great stay  no faults except breakfast
Summary: very clean, plenty of toiletries, spacious room, tv has free hbo, theres free wifi. rooms are extremely comfy, we had a walk in closet with safe, micro fridge, etc. paid 360 for 3 nights just rebooked next stay for 305 (shop around) Ideally located? Not really anything around except fairgrounds, but everything is within a 15-20 minute car ride, such as irvine district, spectrum, even laguna. welcome basket had cheetos, choc chip granola bar, 2 waters, and couple fruit. Was very clean not one hair strand anywhere. Even a toilet sanitized seal upon arrival LOL. Only negative was breakfast; could not be worse (cold, soggy, runny, just disgusting) Stopped after first day.  I would give 5 stars except breakfast was so bad. Well dont expect much when included but this was terrrible.

Summary Heading: Hated my stay at this hotel!!!!
Summary: Hated my stay at this hotel, won't be coming back again! First bad sign, was our check -in...should have left then....they lied about accommodating all our rooms on the first floor, our rate was incorrect! "We will have it fixed when you check out" That didn't happen!!!!! The pool was disgustingly dirty when we came back at 5, all cloudy! Jacuzzi was even worse, like if someone shoveled a pile of dirt at the bottom..it was disgusting!! Internet was out and the rooms smelled of smoke!! So looks like we won't be staying there again! Just cancelled reservation for next month we all had already made prior to this trip! When I complained the gentleman said, "no one else complained!" Wow!!! Great customer service!! Unbelievable! BEWARE people!!! Food was ok! Pretty grouchy server, was

I have stayed at this hote several times this past year and everything has always been first class rate.  I always stay on the 3rd floor, the rooms are clean, great amenities, friendly staff, great service, comfy beds with lots of extra pillows.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Room and Hotel for the value
Summary: Very short distance to some of the best beaches and Balboa Island.  The room was inside. The room had a recliner and we were welcomed with a fruit basket and bottled water.  We were unable to take advantage of the breakfast, but a hot breakfast was offered free at their onsite restaurant.  The price was extremely reasonable.  Staff very friendly.  Wish we had been able to stay longer.

Summary Heading: The most pleasant experience at a hotel
Summary: I was so please with this hotel. The hotel was beautiful inside and out. The employees were so helpful and kind to me. My room was a mazing spacious and clean. The breakfast was amazing and nutritious. I couldn't be happier with my stay. I would stay here again! Thank you Best western

Summary Heading: Used to stay here often...............loved it.......but
Summary: Have one well behaved indoor only, adult, cat.  Since the property does not allow pets anymore (long time ago, they did) I cannot give them my business.  Would love to return here at least 3 times a year for extended stays............but cannot, no pets allowed.  They need to reconsider this, and at least allow one cat.........would be willing to pay pet deposit, though there would never be any damages done by my one gentle cat.  Really miss staying here.........lovely hotel.

We were in Costa Mesa to see a concert & selected this Best Western for their reputation & close proximity to the venue.  It was an average hotel, clean & comfortable.  Parking is hard if you have an oversized vehicle, mine did not fit in the parking structure.  Breakfast was ok, eggs & bacon were cold, but it was ok, the restaurant was crowded & small.  I didn't experience any problems & like I said, it was comfortable & clean, so if you aren't looking for a lot of "extras" it is fine.

Everything was first rate except perhaps the breakfast in the morning. Not so great. The room was clean, amenities were great. Small store open 24 hours was wonderful. Staff was friendly. Not a lot to say in the negative really.

Great staff...clean room and facility...internet reception extremely poor...double beds small for us...would have preferred some hot items included with breakfast...paid less a few miles away in Newport for a much nicer Best Western with greater amenities.

I stay at this hotel at least once a year, and I am always pleased.  The lobby is beautiful, they provide a very nice breakfast, and the rooms are always large and comfortable.  They even provide decent toiletries!

My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Best Westen Plus Newport Mesa Inn.  All I can say is that the daily free breakfast was yummy!  The bed was very comfortable with crisp clean white sheets & fluffy pillows.  The room and entire hotel inside and out was spotless, and did I mention the lobby is absolutely beautiful as well.  This hotel is very nicely located near the beach cities of Newport Beach, Huntington Beach, Balboa, and Laguna Beach.  There are many nice restaurants nearby... like (Woody's Wharf, Dick Churches, The Newport Rib Company & Mama D's Italian restaurant)  Needless to say, this hotel will be our choice when we return to Newport Beach.

Close to beach, shopping and uc irvine.  Neighbourhood could use more amenities but almost everywhere in SoCal requires driving.  Breakfast handy but choice quite limited. Pool good and service excellent.  Stayed a week, and would definitely return. Very clean.  Pleasant stay. Pricing very good for area as well.  Grocery down the street, quiet.

do not hesitate to stay at this best western, comfortable, good size rooms, would have better with sink outside the bathroom, little inconvenient with three adult women trying to get ready.  pool kinda small, breakfast good,  would have liked additional fruit choices and yogurt......internet connection in room did not work with our ipad but they did have computers in the lobby, overall very nice for the price, about 20 mins to the beach and other attractions within a manageable distance, no tour buses (grayline, etc) pick up in the area tho.

Summary Heading: Disappointing stay in Costa Mesa Best Western
Summary: This is "newly remodeled" property that already is quite worn and common carpets are already in need of a good steam cleaning.  Room smelled of smoke and mold, turning on A/C provided more of the same.  Breakfast is the usual Best Western fare served in a very worn and tired attached restaurant.   Of the 20+ Best Westerns I have stayed at, in the bottom 10%.

I have stayed here before, after going to the O.C. fair and concert at the Pacific Amphitheater, and was pretty satisfied. This time was disappointing. The hot/cold handle in the shower was inoperable so the water was scaldingly hot, and we were told it would be fixed while we were out of the room (at the fair and concert). It was not fixed when we got back at 11:15 p.m. that evening. The microwave in the room did not work, and the vending machines in the building weren't functioning properly. Upon checkout, I mentioned the shower problem and the fact that it did not get fixed during our stay, and the response I got was that they would send someone to look at it today (great, since I'll be gone), and that they didn't get to it because they've been REALLY busy. So apparently,

Summary Heading: Great service right by the OC Fair
Summary: The staff at this hotel were really helpful and the room was  really clean.  The location was perfect as it is in walking distance of the OC Fair.  There is a nice parking garage with an elevator and we were put on the ground floor as requested.

Stayed in the middle of June for six days on annual trip from England.  Hotel so convenient for all activities round Costa Mesa, room clean and quiet and good value for money. An excellent complimentary hot breakfast served by friendly staff so much better than many other hotels than we stayed at during our visit to California. Quite busy at weekends but we will definitely use this hotel again.

Nice Clean Hotel, nice amenities & a good location. But don't stay on a Friday or Saturday. On Friday & Saturday the price is a rip off. The parking garage is a nice feature, but there is not enough lighting. The week day rate is competitive. I would stay again, but not on a weekend.

Summary Heading: Good hotel - a good 15mins from Newport town center
Summary: Good hotel overall which is quiet and with a pool/jacuzzi that are clean. Good sized rooms and comfortable seats. Breakfast was average but suitable. Location is OK but about 15 minutes from the town centre but the journey is quick. Nice staff

Nice place ‚Äì clean and updated. Very responsive to customer needs. Good free breakfast ‚Äì eggs, sausage/ham, pastry, cereal, fruit, fresh made waffles, etc. Descent outdoor pool in a nice shady back yard. One flaw ‚Äì we could hear our noisy neighbors.

We usually head for southern California at least once a year, and it's often Newport Beach / Costa Mesa area. This was our first time staying at the Best Western and I have to say could not fault it whatsoever. I asked for a ground floor room for my wife, two small girls and myself, and the room allocated was at the rear of the hotel right next to the pool. The room was spotless and after eating the complimentary breakfasts each morning, we returned to find the room already made up and ready by the efficiency of the maid service. The two girls loved the heated pool , and it usually was all theirs with no other guests using it much at all. The location of this hotel is ideal being right next to the 55 hwy and don't be put off as it was also very quite with zero noise. All of the

This best western was very nice. Clean and convenient.  The handicap room was good as far as the bathroom is concerned.  A perfect bathroom for wheelchair bound people.  Entrance into and out of the room however was difficult. The door is very heavy and does not stay open enabling a wheelchair entrance or exit unless another person is holding it open.  They do have a handicap pool lift available for use. We didn't realize this until the day we were leaving.  The staff should have mentioned this upon check in. The breakfast was just ok, nothing special, the breakfast venue needs updating.  We stayed here 5 days and had a good stay.

Stayed at this hotel for two nights. The reviews were fantastic and I was happy to find a room with two queen beds as I was traveling with my husband and four-year-old daughter. At first the room seemed pretty decent for the price. That is until I tried to use the wifi, which was very spotty and usually only had 2 out of 4 bars on my ipad. Then, when I tried to take a shower I noticed how horrible the shower head was. The water just kind of sputtered out. These things I can deal with. What really bothered me is that my husband checked to see if the window opened and it was unlocked. We were on the first floor and in the back. Behind our window were some weeds, a shortish cement wall, an old piano store (the wall is so short we could easily see people hanging outside of the

Been traveling to Costa Mesa for business every month since September 2012, each trip is for 2-3 nights and need to continue for the rest of 2013. I have tried other Best Western Plus hotels in the area but Newport-Mesa Inn is the best in service and quality, a true plus hotel.  The good: *Location - near OC county fairgrounds, walking distance to Jack in the Box, AM/PM, Subway, Starbucks, sushi restaurant, etc. *Room size - the rooms are huge, plenty of space for business & family trips. *Rooms are very clean. *Room amenities - room safe, coffee maker, iron & iron board, some rooms have dual sinks and some a wet bar area. *Decor - modern, both room & bathroom are well decorated. *Complimentary basket - bottle waters, fruit, cereal/snack bar. *Flat screen television - good size

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, cosy rooms,dirty breakfast venue
Summary: Stayed here for 3 weeks overall not bad but do don't stay near the bk door on the bottom floor poeple will come in and out all night drunk and it bangs very loud. The other problem is the rooms have connecting doors and walls are thin can sound like neighbors are in your room not good when there going at it. We found the breakfast to be disgusting and the kitchen area was dirty. bin near the food dirty floors dirty cups just a dirty place so we ended eating at Dick churchs dinner just down the road it was clean lovely service and a good price. The staff are all great will help u out manger was nice I must say Ashley and cohdie where fantastic we where staying here due to a death in our faimly and they did everything they could to help us but I all so will say the staff can not

After reading previous reviews of this hotel, I was a little nervous about staying at this hotel. However, this hotel surprised me! The hotel is very clean and has been recently remodeled. The staff was very friendly. My room was larger than most rooms. As a special treat, there was a small basket of apples, snacks and water. The complimentary breakfast was enjoyable. It included cereal, toast, waffles, eggs, breakfast potatoes, sausages, fresh fruit, muffins, oatmeal. milk, apple juice, orange juice, coffee and water. This property is in a very busy location (next to the freeway) but it is very quiet. I will definitely stay here next time I am in Southern California.

We have stayed here for the past two years while visiting the Scotfest Highland Games Festival.  This hotel is close to the OC Fairgrounds, the facilities are clean, the price is reasonable, and the staff is friendly.  See you next year.

Summary Heading: Don't have faith in the PLUS rating
Summary: Pros: This location is great. I was traveling last minute and had trouble finding a room for the busy memorial day weekend. When i arrived at the hotel there was one guy working by himself and was on the phone when i arrived/on the computer/talking into a radio all at the same time. Expected a bad attitude from him because he looked stressed out but he was one of the most well informed front desk reps i have ever talked to. Had no problem giving me a quiet room and even offered a discount since i arrived so late on top of helping me with directions for the next day in detail. I made sure to grab his name so i could request him next time, Cody. The beds were nice and the free gift basket was great.   Cons: Breakfast in the morning was good as i just needed something quick but the

I hit this hotel about 4 times a year. Stay one night each time. Positives. Clean, free amenities like water, fruit, snacks. Free fridge to use and micro in most rooms. Big room, you can hook up HDMI devices to the TV, like a Kindle. They also just remodeled. Negative: Near the freeway which is great access but may disturb some. Bring a white noise device and that will cancel all other noise including kids. Stay on the 2nd or 3rd floor for better cell reception. Free wireless.

The Best Western Newport Mesa Inn was a nice find.  The hotel is very clean and despite its location (next to the freeway and John Wayne airport), it was very quiet and comfortable.  Wifi access left much to be desired, but overall the hotel was very good.  Would stay here again and again and...

Summary Heading: My Advice - Stay Away from this Hotel!
Summary: I had the great mis-fortune to obtain this hotel from a Priceline "Name Your Price". FYI: I have had it with Priceline over-rating properties and failing to provide critical information. I no longer use Priceline. i also question the Plus designation by Best Western. This property is in a very busy location as far as traffic and road noise is concerned and access to the hotel and parking is quite difficult. The facilities and rooms are all right, but nothing special. The front desk seemed clueless about everything - basically "throws the key at the guest and disappears". The manager was downright rude. A major complaint is the construction that was underway - at the front entrance- completely blocking access to the hotel and parking (there is no place to stop or park on the busy
Manager Response: Dear Scott,   Thank you very much for completing the survey regarding your recent stay at our property. On behalf of our entire team, would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. We would like to know your  full name and date you stayed with us as we could not locate the record to show your stay. Furthermore, could you please help us the name of our front desk agents who were on duty and tel us about why they were rude and how the Management was was involved as we do not have such experience at all. Irvine Water district did have some construction in the month of Jan/Feb which they did not block the driveway or create any problem during our guests movement and they were very helpfull.  I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.  Sincerely,  Naj Ekhlas General Manager Best Western Plus Newport Mesa Hotel

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights in mid April.  The location was perfect as we were visiting family in both Irvine and Costa Mesa.  The rooms were clean, recently updated and fairly quiet.  The breakfast was what you would expect for a mid price hotel chain.  The room had all granite counter tops, a microwave, small fridge and one cup coffee maker as well as a large screen tv.  The wi-Fi worked well and there were plenty of plugs to charge devices.  The USA Today was available daily.  We did have someone try to scam us by phone during our stay, but a quick call to the front desk verified that it was indeed a scam.   So if you get a call in your room saying the hotel has "lost" your reservation info, just tell them you will go down to the front desk to straighten it out.

Summary Heading: good value at Costa Mesa Best Western
Summary: This was our second stay at this hotel.  The price was very reasonable, the decor was clean and new, the room size was good with a little fridge and coffee, and the wireless internet was relatively fast.  Hot breakfast was very good value.  Aside from the location being a bit out of the way and tricky to get to, though in a safe area (not a problem with GPS, though) this is a very good place to stay for a family.

My mother and I were seeing Wicked at the Performing Arts Center and chose this hotel based on previous reviews. The location was perfect, just a couple of miles from the show, and right off the 55 fwy. The room was nicely appointed with a flat screen tv, desk, fridge, microwave, and updated decor. It was very quiet, and had inside corridors. The breakfast was a cut above most freebies with real scrambled eggs (as opposed to the flat medallions), sausage, toast, bagels, cereal, fruit, and not so great pastries. The staff was friendly and check in seamless. All in all a good value for the area at 89.00/night.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, breakfast not so "Hot All-American"?
Summary: The hotel itself is very nice and clean, we would definately stay here again for the "hotel" part again. Easy access parking, elevator very nice decor throughout lobby, public space and the rooms. But we booked this hotel because we like to laze around on holidays in the morning, my son is not a morning person, he does not want to run for food before he is ready to and by this time his mom is ready for lunch............the "all-american breakfast" turned out to be cold "churzo eggs, some kind of a sausage pattie, and cold panfries. A cup of coffee was a battle for some as no cups either day (the attendant would rather explain to the poor lady looking for a cup of something "hot" how all the cups moved into the hotel rather than GET a CUP) were available? In a food environment

Summary Heading: The best hotel in the area
Summary: We recently stayed here since I was having surgery at nearby Hoag Hospital and since we live far away chose this motel for our stay, and we were not disappointed.  We stayed here 3 nights.  The rooms are quiet, we had noisy neighbors one night, one call the front desk was all it took to quiet them down a little(certainly not the hotel's fault).  Rooms are very clean and smell  nice.  Bedding was nice and fresh.  Bathroom had granite countertops, shower was lined with granite, the bathroom was very nice.  Room had a refrigerator with a nice extra countertop next to the bathroom door.  We stayed in one of the third floor rooms, and they gave us a little basket of apples, water and granola bars.  Bathrobes and slippers were a nice bonus.  TV was large with many channels.  I never

Summary Heading: The Best Value in the Area
Summary: Last year we had business requiring a number of trips to the Newport Beach/Costa Mesa area. After trying other spots this became our favorite because of the value and service. As it turns out we found out some of our neighbors had to travel to the area frequently and they also became regulars at Newport Mesa Inn. It is very well maintained, the rooms are large and the access to area freeways is very good. If you can get rooms away from the front highway access it is quiet in the evenings. We had occasion to visit last week and as usual it was a very good experience and the breakfast has been improved. It is self service and you have some fresh hot dishes every day along with typical oatmeal, rolls and fruit. If you are on a budget and want to stay in the area this is a place for

I have been staying at this hotel during a business trip to Los Angeles/San Diego. We made a short term reservation, everthing worked out very well. Rooms a quite large and more important looked very proper. Hotel is offering complimentary water, small snacks and apples. Was very pleased about it.  As the hotel is located next to a highway it's not a quiet location.  Unfortunately breakfast in Francesca's cafe was very poor. Not only the cups have been not clean, the entire room looked e same. Selection of offered food is an absoute minimum as breakfast is very important for me to have a good star into the day. It's my second stay in a best western hotel, both times I made the same experience.

Checked in for a two night stay, of which one night was to be on a free BW voucher.First night was great and we proceeded on to see family the next day.When we returned late the next evening we found ourselves locked out of the room.The front desk clerke which was the same guy that checked us in the night before, said we were only checked in for one night. He said we were suppose to check out and back in? He tried to make it seem as though it was somehow are fault.I am not a BW employee and if knowone tells us the procedure how would we know?? The guy was a jerk!! Had to re check in with cc info again and another hold on my card. Very dissappointed for a Platinum member.

Summary Heading: The Best for a reasonable price
Summary: What's more to want from a budget level motel????.........  Computers in the lobby, hot and cold complimentary breakfasts, eated pool and spa, large rooms, 3 sinks, coffeemaker, microwave, refrig., HBO, nice recliner for TV watching, smokefree, free wifi in rooms, hot showers with high shower heads, right at the freeway on-ramp.  They are replacing all the corridor wallpaper and have recently replaced the stone at the entrances.

Summary Heading: This hotel reminded me of all the reasons i love Best Western
Summary: A flagship Best Western if one ever was, this hotel is wonderful, Good prices when no event is scheduled nearby, wonderful room, and great service.   Was so pleased with the stay, hated to leave the location. The room was big and roomy more like a one room suite, with a nice sofa area, and the biggest walk in closet i've ever seen in a room, at least on my income level. Had a wonderful quiet corner room, loved the wood blinds.... didn't want to leave in the morning so got a late start lol.   Cannot wait to return, thank you to all the staff at the Best Western Plus Newport Mesa Inn!

This was my 5th stay at the Mesa Inn and it never disappoints!  Staff is always friendly and helpful.  Francesca's cafe is delightful, and so is she.  Time for new mattress covers, at least in the room we occupied, and a new motor for the vent in the bathroom (very noisey). Thanks for the new remotes! We will be back!

We had a great stay, & the little extras the motel furnished were an added bonus for us.  The morning breakfast was also good and was more like a home cooked meal than in  other motels.  We would definitely stay there again.

My son and I stayed here in early October, we were very happy with the room and the check in/check out people.  The location is very handy with great freeway access, and I didn't notice the noise level being excessive.  I appreciated the lower level parking, and the breakfast was better than what you get at most hotels.  Four stars for the property, the fifth would be for the value.

We returned to this hotel as we so enjoyed our last visit there in April 2012. We loved having breakfast with the lady that prepares it daily. I will say that last April the food was of much more variety. This past visit, it was the same day after day. It was good food, only would have enjoyed the variety we enjoyed in the spring.  The staff was friendly and the room was clean & comfortable. We like this location as it is close to the areas we like to visit.  The only downfall was the construction taking place in the parking lot. We will stay there again and visit our friend in the breakfast room.

I travel a lot and just recently discovered the Best Western Plus hotels.  I now seek them out when traveling.  I just stayed in the Best Western Plus Newport Mesa Inn.  It was great.  The rooms are quite large and have separate seating areas and a nice big desk.  They also have a separate area with coffee maker and refrigerator.  This particular one even had a gift basket with very nice goodies.  The beds and pillows are very comfortable which is very important to me.  I also love that they always have coffee and tea in the lobby.  They have free breakfast, wifi, and parking.  The staff is always very nice and helpful.  I will definitely stay here again when I'm back in the area.

Summary Heading: Excellent value, excellent service, excellent bed
Summary: Who would have thought that a Best Western was anything to write home about?  But staying there was wonderful - the staff that went out of their way to help, the comfy beds, terrific location.  I'd have given it a 5, but I reserve that for places that are above excellent.  And especially for the value, this place was excellent!

we were treated wonderfully by the staff, especially Omar was very personable and took good care of us.  the room was very clean and spacious, beds were comfy, beautiful decor and updated. the ladies at the desk were helpful and friendly. i walked over to the breakfast area at night to get a soda, i was told the woman was in the kitchen, i called her from the doorway to the kitchen and was shocked at how filthy it was.  we did go down to breakfast, food was disappointing, eggs were room temperature and was told they ran out of bacon, pastries tasted stale . the woman working there was very abrupt and had a bad attitude, unprofessional and told us she had to start cleaning up when it was 45 minutes til breakfast was over.

Just wanted to report that my family of 6 adults and 4 kids thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Newport Mesa Best Western for a week (3 rooms).  The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean and quiet.  There was even a coin laundry center near our rooms!  We were located near the fitness center and pool so the kids were happy.  Free wifi and free breakfast made the adults happy.  Francesca's Restaurant on site  provided a hot breakfast every day in a pleasant environment.  It would have been nice to have waffles available but there were several other choices.  We were in town for a wedding and our relatives live in Newport Beach.  The hotel was convenient to the freeway system which was wonderful for sightseeing and our relatives.  All in all we would

We were given a disabled room when I'm sure there are other rooms available since its on a Wednesday night in October and the parking lot wasn't full. We asked if they have a king size bed room available and instead of saying we can switch you to one, he answered with a question if we wanted a king bed like he didn't want to switch so I said never mind when. We were tired and it was late and just wanted to go to sleep. When we got arrived to our room, #133, we weren't too please because it was right off the lobby and afraid it would be noisy in the morning. Walked into the room and it was musty. The bed and sheets seems old. I walked into the bathroom and realized it was a wheelchair accessible room with a roll in shower. Its midnight, and we did not want to pack our things to

Well located, clean room, warm swimming pool, kind people, nice breakfast, near University of California in Irvine, only few minutes from Disneyland, Spectre Mall, golf courses, wonderful beaches, etc... The wi-fi coverage need to be improved and boosted.

Couple days stay while visiting family. The rooms have been recently renovated and it was a very good job for a low-mid tier chain. Slept well and never had any issue with anything... hot water was hot and ac worked fine.  This hotel is very convenient to airport and really all of Orange County locations.  About 15 min to beach. Breakfast included with stay was simple but step above most "continental" and included bacon, eggs and fried potatoes along with the regular stuff.  Fair grounds are directly across the street.

Had a great experience, unbeatable price very clean and quiet rooms. Spacious rooms with drawers desk table... And we got the standard cheapest one! Nice updated bathroom. Heated pool my daughter enjoyed it! Free parking free wifi and free breakfast all included. Small cozy hotel with a great location close to Newport beach, irvine spectrum and pacific cost freeway! Close to highway but no noise! All this for under 100$ promotional rate and they also gave us a baby crib for free!!

The rooms are very clean and comfortable, good staff, however the internet is very slow, the bathroom shower is not very efficient, all these can can be overcome. The most uncomfortable was the breakfast the lady running the buffet did not provide a friendly atmosphere and comfort when eating, made ‚Äã‚Äãyou feel uncomfortable. Breakfast is very basic and you have to ask her for things you want to eat.

I had family stay at this hotel because they wanted a location close to the beach and the fair , swap meet. This hotel was perfect for both. They especially enjoyed the no fuss, delicious breakfast. The chorizo eggs were very good , not the predictable standard fair .The rooms were clean,staff was especially professional and helpfull. I'm so happy my family found a hotel they really enjoyed staying at . keep up the good work.  dan

A friend and I stayed a week and was very happy with everything. Had covered parking with a elevator for easy access to rooms never a parking issue. Pool was a little small but never crowded and very clean. Hot tub was nice but the jets just kinda shot up in the air ,was very warm and clean also.Room was nice and comfy , very cold air . Food at Francesas was great, looked forward to a nice breakfast every morning. Never had to go far for a hearty dinner either its all here, the dinners were fabulous!!!

I have been a regular here at this best western for several years now. the service is very nice. the complimetery breakfast is always great served fresh to you. not grab and go. the personal TOUCH brings me back and friendly service is a great plus. especally for those here on business away from home.. the breakfast staff seems to have toughest job in the hotel.Busy mornings. at fair time and packed weekends i have seen the dining fill in a matter of mins.And most always the staff seem to with determination and grace fill all the guests plates.For sure the breakfast lady could use more help but, as for my many visits here I recomend this best western to my family and friends. Ask for mary and look for Francesca if you are hungry Her Pizza Rocks. Or Just craving a late night

Decided to stop in costa mesa on our drive back home from mexico. Everyone else was sold out due to fair nearby and some surfing event at the beach; finally got to the end of the strip at best western. way over priced for the location, but overall decent stay. However, there as alot noise in the parking lot shortly after we arrived. we had checked in late and wanted to get a little sleep before we hit the road next morning. called from desk to complain and they just said dont worry about.... that was it... nothing just "dont worry about it" and hung up. called back, upset by their response, and was clear about it, the guy then apologized for the inconvenience and the short response, then advised they were dealing with the situation
