Your feed back helping us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.  We apologize for not exceeding your expectation to earn your 100% satisfaction. We hope to serve you once again in the near future so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.   Sincerely,  Naj Ekhlas General Manager

Summary: I had another excellent overnighter at the Newport Mesa Inn in Orange County CA. Location is perfect. Front dest is always friendly and hospitable.Pool and jacuzzi are new and prestine. Room is spotless and smell so good when you walk in. Breakfast at Francesco`s is exceptional in an intimate Italian setting with seating indoors and outdoors. I got there just before the "rush" and had exceptional service and many options to choose with hot breakfast entrees. I recommend this hotel minutes to Newport Beach, South Coast Plaza, the OC airport and freeways.

For my short business stay, this hotel had everything I needed.  Easy access to the 55 freeway, a marvelously clean room, plenty of space, a flat screen TV, free WiFi and ample parking.  The front desk was friendly, courteous and helpful.  So why not 5 stars?  The breakfast was just decent; very typical hotel fair.  No complaint; it just is what it is...  The AC was incredibly loud, and if I wasn't so tired it would have kept me up all night.  Maybe it was just my room, but it who knows?  Finally, the exercise room was below par, but I have to sy I haven't been to very may really good ones in hotels at this level.  All in all, a very good choice.  Make sure you get a good price to seal this deal.

this hotel was quality - clean and comfortable, 24hr desk, hot breakfast, excellent facilities, quiet (double glazed windows), fast hard-wired internet, elevator, close to the attractions, lovely helpful staff + not expensive = made my stay

The location next to the 55 South is a plus and a minus.  It's very convenient during non rush hour, exit the hotel and you're right on the freeway to wherever you need to go, but during rush hour there is a bit of traffic getting to the hotel from the 55 south.  A good solution I discovered was taking the exit at Bristol and going down Baker or Paularino to the 55 on-ramp. From there, I can pretty much cut right to the fairgrounds which the hotel is located next to.  The hotel itself is quite a suprise.  I learned that it was upgraded from a regular Best Western to a plus not too long ago and that explains how this is much better than the BWs I've stayed at before.  Not that they were bad, but they weren't great.  This one certainly beats going to a travelodge or any of the

This should be a Beste Western PLUS but how can you say it when the shower is horrible, wi-fi works very bad, rooms are hot and old and breakfast is not so rich. Ok rooms are spaciuos and bed is confy but you can find better solutions at this prize.
Manager Response: Dear Honorable Guest,   Thank you very much for taking the time writing a review on TripAdvisor to let us and others know about your recent stay at our property.  We apologize for not exceeding your expectation but just let you know that the Hotel rooms have been renovated just a few moths ago and we do have 300m/20 internet service in house with 24/7 technical support and providing an excellent complementary Hot breakfast which our guests love it. I am sorry to here that you did not have good experience in your last stay. We hope that you will consider staying with us again in the near future so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.   Sincerely,  Naj Ekhlas General Manager

Summary: We stayed here several years ago and it appears that the hotel has since been upgraded. Our room was very nice, with very comfy beds and lots of fluffy pillows. The little fruit basket was appreciated. We like to stay here when the OC fair is in town so we can walk (it's a hike) to the fairgrounds for a concert and amusement. Check in and out was a breeze, the hotel appears to be very clean and well taken care of with friendly staff, coffee maker in room , bathtub with shower etc. The free breakfast is now in a cafe across from the lobby, hot food is served, not buffet style ,scrambled eggs, sausage and potatoes during our visit. No waffles :( . There is also an assortment of breads, muffins, rolls, some fruit,cereal,  OJ. Both toasters were broken which was frustrating, the

The hotel was clean, with a nice pool area, odd jacuzzi and smaller fitness room. The room was clean.  The TV controls were hard to figure out. They don't have a sign with instructions. The breakfast was nice which included eggs, sausage and potatoes.  Good coffee.  Great location.   Bed was a little hard and pillows a little difficult, but overall comfy.  LARGE room.  The only negative was the rude clerk in the evening when we checked in on July 21, 2012. She had no patience for anyone and had a major attitude.  Even when we called later to figure out the TV.  The clerk in the morning on check out was very nice.

We staye here for two nights recently.  The facility was nice and clean, however the accuracy of our billing was an issue.  We were charged twice for a two nights stay.  When I called them to let them know what had transpired, all I got was excuses, none of them even close to admitting it was their error.  The issue was resolved after a few days, but this experience left us a bit disappointed on how it was handled.  No apology whatsoever.

The phone in the room did not work nor did the television.  When I went to the front desk the lady indicated they knew and had trouble earlier in the day.  You would have thought they might have checked the unoccupied rooms to insure all was working.  Additionally had to set the AC to 64 before it would start.  Toilet paper roll falls out of holder.  The room is spacious with a rather uncomfortable 1950's style couch.  It was OK for a one night stay close to Orange Airport but I would not want to be here for any length of time.

We apologize to hear that you had such experience during your stay in July 2012   Since your stay was in 2012 we are unable to have any record of your stay with us. We hope to serve once again very soon in the near future to earn you 100% satisfaction.  Sincerely,  Naj Ekhlas General Manager

Summary: Great hotel for no frills. Close to OC fairgrounds, mall & beach. Clean rooms, customer service great, free breakfast & no charges for parking. Will stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Diana,   Thank you very much for taking the time writing a review on TripAdvisor to let us and others know about your recent stay at the Best Western Plus Newport Mesa Hotel in Costa Mesa/Newport BH  Your feed back and complements about or team and property are greatly appreciated and hope to serve you once again very soon in the near future to be able to earn your 100% satisfaction.  Once again thank you very much for your wonderful review.  Sincerely,   Naj Ekhlas Genrel Manager

Summary: After an expensive stay at a worn out Santa Monica motel, my husband and I were delighted to arrive at the Best Western location the next night. The property is well maintained and the rooms are clean and up to date. The price of a room does not reflect the quality. This is a first rate location that we will absolutely stay at again while visiting my son in Newport Beach.

Summary: She really is a sweetheart. And Mary at the front desk the night before was so helpful and accommodating. I chose wisely.
costa mesa great staff clean comfortable rooms  restaurant next door close to freeway but we did not hear any traffic noise ideal for catalina flyer ferry to catalina

Summary Heading: What! This is a Best Western???
Summary: We went to Costa Mesa for a wedding, decided to stay another day, however the hotel we were going to stay at was not available, so we booked the Best Western.  We arrived to a wonderful employee at the front desk, so happy and made us feel so welcome.  We asked about a restaurant for burgers and she gave us some ideas.  The lobby was so beautiful, marble floors, staircase.  Our room, was so nice, and so clean.  It was also triple sheeted, which I love.  But best of all there was a fruit basket waiting for us on the table, with 2 bottles of water, what a nice touch.  We had a great breakfast at the hotel also.  If you are in Costa Mesa, this is a wonderful place to stay, highly recommend.

Got a great rate @ $90/night through AAA. Pretty nice room - plenty of space, clean, comfortable bed, fridge, free hot breakfast, free wifi, cableTV, etc. Very close to great restaurants. Maid service was outstanding. A big problem was the A/C: would not work with 'fan only': kept recycling loudly during the night, off/on/off/on - had to put in ear plugs to have a quiet night. Another problem is many guests at this motel seemed to be at the low class, tattoo‚Äôs,slobs,loud end of the human scale.  Example: upon our checkout at 5AM, the desk clerk called a room and said "Please lower your music, it's 5 AM and people are sleeping." That is kind of good, because we've read on other posts that at other hotels management were unresponsive to noisy neighbors, saying 'sorry, there's

My wife and I wanted to catch the Newport Beach ferry to Santa Catalina Island at 9 a.m., but we did not want to fight Orange County morning traffic. We decided to stay at this Best Western. Given that it is located in a pricey area, it was a pleasant surprise to find a room that cost a bit more than $80. It was a very nice room, especially spacious. The bed was very comfortable. The piece de resistance: the glasses in the bathroom were glass, not some cheap cardboard. We both enjoyed the hot breakfast. Although the hotel is adjacent to the 55 Freeway, we heard no road noise. Although neither of us likes Orange County, we are tempted to go back because the hotel was so nice. The only problem we encountered was how to turn on the television in the room. Someone on the staff

The BW Newport Mesa Inn was a pleasant nights stay.  The rooms were very spacious and includes a complimentary fruit basket which was a very nice touch for weary travelers.  The breakfast was above average with freshly cooked eggs, bacon and potatoes.  This hotel is right at the entrance to I-55 and I thought there would be a lot of noise from traffic, but we still had a good night sleep.  It was so convient to hop on the freeway and get to the airport quickly.  There is also a gas station right next to the BW Newport Mesa Inn so filling up the rental car before returning to the airport was a snap.

Summary Heading: Great value without giving up anything
Summary: The room was spacious.  It was very quiet there even though it was just off the freeway.  Nice small, heated pool and hot tub.  Small but adequate exercise room.  Breakfast was better than just a continential breakfast, with some hot foods.
Loved the hotel, staff, breakfast, bed, room design, and location.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for the right place near Newport Beach
Summary: We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel near the beach, and found this perfect place.  Minutes from Newport Beach.  Rooms were nice, comfortably set up.  Free breakfast at the restaurant next door, home-cooked and served.  If you are looking for an affordable, nice place to stay, near the beaches or Disneyland, check this place out.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when you go to Catalina!
Summary: I had family in town and had plans to take the Catalina Flyer to Catalina Island. Since I live in Hollywood, we got a room at the BW Newport Mesa Inn for the weekend we went there! It was a very short drive to Balboa Pier and we had a place close by to head to after the day trip!   Hotel was clean and kept well. We needed an extra bed so we got their "family" room, which was the meeting room, but they rolled in 2 queen beds and made it a big comfy room! The sofa bed was the BEST sofa bed I have ever slept on! Nice soft top futon, IKEA look to it, but WAY more comfy!! The room was neat, no dirt, no scum in the bathroom, no smells. Hotel facilities were also clean. Pool was outside, so we didnt try it, the jacuzzi was in the fitness center. Jets were a little extreme and

My wife and I spent three nights here and enjoyed our stay very much.  The rooms were clean and smoke free and the maintenance of the facility was kept up very well.  They even gave us a FREE room upgrade when we arrived without asking.   Staff was very nice and accommodating, pool was kept very clean and the onsite dinning facility, Francesca's Cafe, was always available with a smile and a good home cooked meal for breakfast and dinner.  The location worked very well for us as it allowed us easy access to where we need to go and to Newport Beach, and other attractions in the greater Orange County area.    Starbucks and convenience stores were in walking distance a block away with other quick eats available as well.  We didn't decide to get a rental car but adopted our own local

We needed a hotel that all the family could afford, stay together, be  nice, clean, with breakfast and  has good ratings. A plus on all accts. Under 90.00, the breakfast was made to order, the room is like a little cafe to eat. So we were all able to sit together for a farewell meal. The room was very nice, double sink, good shower, very very quiet.  Parking was easy, Many near the doors for HC spots. Remember this is Coast Mesa, so the addresses start again for Newport Beach Locations. We were referred to a nice family restaurant 5 doors up, food was great, no need to drive until we were ready for Newport Beach. All in all, We would def do this again. Oh, pool, free computer and printer and little service store in the lobby. Didn't use them.

This Best Western is fabulous! The decor is 1st class with beautiful carpet in the hallways and with a lobby beautifully decorated for the holidays. The rooms have marbled counter tops with very nice chairs and tables. Drapes, bedding and in room carpets are clean, new and classy. Large flat screen TV and quick wi fi internet service works great. Although near a freeway, the well insulated windows block out all sound. The free breakfast is great in a quaint dining room. Coffee, juices, pancakes, eggs, bacon, potatoes, breads,, bagels muffins, breakfast bundt cakes and cereal make this a bargain included in your hotel rate! There is nothing but praise for this wonderful hotel and it lacks nothing. Friendly staff and quick check in make it a first-class experience!

Summary Heading: Nice clean place at great location, but this friendly staff put it over the top.
Summary: Everything was great.  The friendly staff were very helpful in recommending great local places to get everything we needed/wanted.
The staff is friendly, the room was big, the pools are great. The breakfast was a little disappointing, not bad.

An incredible value and an immaculately clean and updated room. We stayed just one night because of a quick trip. We have stayed at many higher priced hotels in the Newport Beach area that paled in comparison. We definitely will stay here again and enjoy the money saved on other outings in the area!

When I was looking for places to stay they all had some pretty bad ratings except this place so I decided to trust the ratings and go for it and I was glad I did it was a nice place to stay with a good comp. breakfast. Close to everything we needed to visit and at a fairly ok price they could be a little cheaper. We stayed for a week and we were happy enough staying there. People were friendly and helpful. I did like that they had a free shuttle back to the airport when we needed to go pick up our rental car the next day.

All things we read about the place are correct, room was very nice and clean, staff was great. Pool and spa, very nice lobby, free computers to use in lobby. Little store by main counter to buy some snacks etc. The free breakfast is just accross from lobby in a restaurant. Eggs, bacon, sausage, home fries etc with all the cereals etc. The restaurant makes a great pizza and will deliver to your room.  No microwave but I think they will give you one if you ask-small fridge in room.  Hotel is right off the 55 so you can get anywhere. We like to go to Newport Beach. We drive South on Newport Blvd about 16th St(A church is on the corner) parking there and some small restaurants. Plus bathrooms are right there. Parking is Free after 6PM. meters take crdit/debit cards. Rent some bikes

This hotel is fantastic.  Rates are some of the lowest in Orange County for a decent hotel, but what you get is better than what I've gotten in Hiltons.  The rooms are beautifully decorated, with a welcome basket that has fruit, granola bar and water.  The toiletries are wonderful, with lotions, bath gel, shampoo, conditioner, oatmeal soap, sewing kit, etc, etc.  The included full breakfast is unique and very good - it's not a buffet, but a cooked to order omelet (scrambled eggs, oatmeal, bagels, etc., also available).  I've stayed in many Orange County hotels and this is the best value.

Summary Heading: Pet Friendly...‚àö Location...‚àö Relaxing Pool...‚àö Free Parking and Wi-Fi...‚àö Clean...‚àö
Summary: My review says it succinctly but my husband, dog and I were so happy with this hotel we will definitely be staying there again. It's at the 55 freeway so you can jump on and go to the amusement parks, LA or the beaches quickly. The pool is surprisingly nice and in the back which helps keep it relaxing. They even left us bottled water and fresh fruit.   The only things I can say were not excellent are these: 1. Bathroom smelled when we got there but the fan quickly fixed that 2. The free breakfast was not our thing but there were a number of people eating it so I guess we are picky 3. I think the carpets are cleaned regularly and the chemical residue stays in them. My feet were not happy but my husband didn't notice. I wore slippers and it was fine.

My stay here was great!  They had a very nice, roomy, clean room with free wifi.  The wifi in my room was a bit slow, but none-the-less, it worked fine.  They had a small "business center" near the lobby where there was also access to a printer (which is essential when I travel on business).  They also had a small, but very clean fitness center.  I would definitely stay there again.  PLUS, there was a Starbucks just down the street within walking distance.

As stated in all the other reviews, the rooms are every clean and large. Great water pressure and LOTS of hot water. Great value and much more than you'd expect for less than $100. It's quiet for the most part, and great for any type of traveler. BUT it is important to note that there are lost of clubs and bars within a 3 mile radius and there are occasionally drunk clubbers in the hallways and the pool late at night. Be patient with them (it's better than a DUI) and know that the front desk will address the issue if you inform them. If you are a part of a large group, ask for a room at the end of the hallway away from others. Finally, after staying there multiple times, we've found the AAA discount on their own website to be lowest rate--check that before you book with a 3rd

Summary Heading: Letting the Cat Out of the Bag
Summary: Set inland off the 55 from Newport Beach, CA this little spot affords a quiet night's sleep in a nicely decorated, clean room.  You're greeted by a beautiful chandelier, mirrored wall & circular staircase in the lobby & friendly, courteous staff.  Despite being sold out we heard no noise either night.  Housekeeping was helpful & common areas & rooms clean and comfortable.  Breakfast is included with eggs cooked to order, bacon or sausage, cereal bar, fruit, breads & juice.  Underground parking was available but we parked under our window each night.  This was our 3rd visit to this hotel this year & although we'd like to keep it our little secret will risk letting the cat out of the bag so others discover a secret of their own.

Extremly nice staff,made fresh coffee just for us on our late night arrival,Rooms are Very Clean,Delicious Free Breakfast,Cant beat this Hotel for the price,not far from the pier at all,its in a great senic area..No Compaints,,we will be returning to newport beach for a couples getaway in march 2011 and will definitly be staying here again since we had such a GREAT experience here the 1st time around! :)
Hotel was nice and clean but hope you have quiet people in room next to you because walls are thin.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel and centrally located
Summary: It was close to the beaches and the john wayne airport.  Check in was easy.  I was sharing the room with my daughter and friend and we found the accommodations perfect.  The breakfast in the morning was great also.  My friiend checked out late than us and that did pose a problem because she left the key iwth the maid instead of going to the front desk and I was charged an extra night.  But after a few phone calls they reversed the charges so all in all it was a great stay and would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Best Western Newport Mesa Inn Nice people
Summary: Very nice staff and very helpful, great location, very clean nice place only thing I did not like the coffee pots are to small

We stayed here for one night because it was walking distance to the O.C. County Fair and Pacific Amphitheater. We had a lot of fun at the fair and the concert afterward. The room was average, but the toilet seat cover came off the toilet!!! The pool was nice but the jacuzzi was BOILING hot -- waaaay too hot to even keep your feet in. Crazy. We told maintenance about it, but I don't know if they fixed it because we left the next day. This was definitely not the greatest Best Western we've ever been to. I would rate it a little below average for the price.

Stayed in Newport for one night and picked out the Newport Mesa BW hotel due to price/reviews. The hotel had a some what strange layout with nice furnishings and pleasant break out areas in the hall ways, the hotel looked nice and in keeping with Newport area.   Our room was clean and a good size, the pool area also clean and quiet which made for a relaxing few hours in the sunshine.  No complaints or issues with this Hotel, well worth a look if you are in the Newport area.

I've stayed here before and found it basic and clean. This time, the updated new furnishings makes a big difference, and the most important is the cleanliness.  I enjoyed the daily breakfasts. Free wi-fi is very big on my list.  I don't think hotels should make customers pay for internet access. and, the staff were very helpful and friendly. overall, i highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area!

This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel.. the last time being a few years back and wow the rooms have been renovated!  The new furniture and interiors are great additions to this wonderful hotel.  Just the basics here, but what else do you need in a hotel?  A nice clean room, friendly staff, free wifi internet, lots of parking, and free breakfast.  I spend most of the day outside of the hotel so I don't need a swimming pool (though they have one) or big indoor gym (I think they have a few exercise equipments).  I like the location--it's right off the 55 freeway by Newport Beach and Costa Mesa which makes it convenient to goto Newport or hop on the 55 and right onto the 405 or 73 (a main artery in so cal) to everywhere you need to go (South Coast Plaza, Disneyland,

Summary Heading: Dead Hotel But Good Breakfast Service
Summary: When I checked into the hotel (early), I was pleasantly surprised at the appearance of the lobby.  Though there were no cars in the parking lot, everything seemed clean and ready for business.  The room was clean and it included a sofa, which was nice.  There was a tile missing from the wall in the bathroom, though.    As check-in time arrived, the parking lot failed to fill much more.  Of course, this helped keep the noises and disturbances to a minimum.  But when we payed to view a movie, the video vibrated, which was annoying.  Even worse was near the climax of the movie when the screen flipped rapidly.  I called the front desk, but they said it was out of their control and a problem of the service they employed.  They discounted the movie from my bill.  When I went for a

We have stayed in many hotels at much higher prices.  This hotel is unbelievable value, very clean and nicely appointed.  We were very pleasantly surprised as we felt the room was much better than expected.

We just returned from spending 5 days in Costa Mesa, and have nothing but praise for the Best Western and its staff.  Our room was clean, the beds were very comfortable and the linens were fresh and changed daily.  The staff were very friendly and were definately focused on good customer service.  Even though the hotel is right on Newport Blvd, we did not have any problem with noise.  The air conditioner was a little noisy, but we had the option to turn it off!  Having access to free internet was a real bonus as the California wildfires broke out while we were there.  This made it very easy to check our flight times as well as change our shuttle pickup.  The free breakfast left something to be desired, but there is a great local eatery (Dick Churches) at the end of the block

First room smelled like cigarette smoke so I requested another one. Second room was ok (3rd floor). Could not hear trafiic noise although hotel is very close to 55 hwy. Whole hotel would need renovation. Both rooms felt kind of damp. Service was good. Breakfast was included but very basic. For $100 ok hotel, but fairly basic and old.

Incredibly kind and efficient service.  Very close to John Wayne, SNA, airport.  Courtesy shuttle upon arrival which took 10 minutes to arrive and about 5 minutes to get me to the front desk.    The king size bed was unbelievably comfortable -- not saggy and droopy like many hotels.  I don't know if it was just my room or if they've recently updated their beds.  I had a good night's sleep.    My third floor room was quiet and I did not hear any strange noises in the middle of the night.  It was very clean but lacked some wall art to make it feel more welcoming.  It had recently been partially renovated in terms of furniture and the bathroom.  The shower pressure was more than adequate.  The phone didn't work however but I don't think that's a problem for cell phone users.  No in
This was your average hotel, but good for the price in this area - if you don't mind being a bit further from the beach.  It was clean and provided a decent place to stay for a night.

Some will be disappointed here if they are looking for paradise.  But for an area of over-priced hotels, this place is a huge bargain.  It's a tad beat-up but pretty clean, free wireless, good location.  Moderate your expectations and you'll feel good about the deal.  Jack-in-the Box a couple doors down....go get your tacos, do e-mail, go to bed.

We recently stayed at the Newport Mesa Best Western.  The hotel was clean and bland. But -- every morning they had a full breakfast that was very good. We had eggs, bacon, potatoes, pastry, bagels, cereal, etc.  It was restocked as things ran out. They have a nice huge dining room.  It was well worth the price when you figure in the breakfast.  It wasn't expensive but with the breakfast I saved about $40 more dollars at least. I would definitely go back here again.  The rooms were average. The usual for this price chain.  But the staff was friendly.  And the location was great. You could just jump on the 55.  The OC Swap Meet is right across the highway. This was also a fantastic thing to do.

I have stayed at the BW Newport Mesa Inn in Costa Mesa 4 times, the last time February 5. All of the rooms that I stayed in were clean & large.  This hotel provides 24 hour coffee, a very decent Free breakfast (eggs, bacon,potatoes, bakery products, cereal, juices, coffee & tea), Free wireless internet access, pool, spa, sauna and exercise room. The staff is very helpful and nice. Housekeeping comes early.          The only two complaints that I have about this hotel is that the wireless signal is not strong enough to be useful from every room in the hotel (even with the hotels equipment) and (greedy me) I would like a few more tv channels. On the whole I prefer it to the Comfort Inn down the street.

Stayed there for one night on 12/4. Room 101, main building, just off the lobby. Newly remodeled with corian in bathroom, new carpets, etc.  King size bed and room three times the size of friend's room at Marriott in Newport Beach.  Purchased through Priceline for $65.

This place well fool you it looks great on the out side rooms stained and the ac are bad and old the management is also bad stayed there with my service dog and i was told to use the back door. this property is owned by someone esle so calling best western will not help you. There are to many good motel on the same sreet and two with arms throw so try them they are better i should know i run a motel in northern calif.

I booked 10 nights at this hotel (sight unseen).  I had never been to CA before, so I researched many hotels before settling on this one, as I got the lowest price out of many others in the area.  I referred to the BW website as well as the trip advisor reviews (all quite favorable) to assist me with my decision.  I arrived at the hotel with my boyfriend on 6-10-04 and we were very disappointed.  The hotel does not look nearly as nice as it does on the web pictures.  I asked the girl at the desk if we could see the room before deciding to stay for a long duration.  She said it would be no problem and gave us the key.  I was told that I would get a "pool view" (which there doesn't seem to be any), and instead the room was on the first floor down the hall from the lobby (the

Stayed here recently with my wife for a little gettaway. The executive suite is clean and the bed is comfortable. During the day I was able to work from the room with the DSL connection while my wife shopped at the nearby South Coast Plaza. There is a very nice Swap-Meet that takes place right across the hotel on Sat. and Sun. I was able to relax and get work done, to me, that's 2 birlds with one stone.

The accommodations were nice and clean, we had a coffee maker and fridge in the room.  The bed was comfortable and the room was large.   Also a convenient location to shopping and the freeway.  The desk person was also very friendly.  Would recommend.

We stayed here for 2 nights in a Deluxe King room.  The room is very well kept, and clean.  The complimentry breakfast isn't just a muffin and oj, but a nice selection of bagels, cereal, bread, and various pastries.  I was able to do my job in Costa Mesa while the property is located conveniently for my wife to shop at South Coast plaza and Newport Beach.  Overall, its a great place to stay with good amenities.

We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds and it was roomy enough for 3 adults, a toddler and an infant.  We didn't spend much time in our room but the motel was comfortable enough and the staff friendly enough. The area seemed safe.  Our room was conveniently located next to the stairs and the laundry room. If you need an elevator, request a room near the lobby. There was even an internet connected computer that guests were allowed to use. The complimentary breakfast was okay. No eggs and bacon here just your toast, cereal, and fruit. Although it is located next to a freeway, we couldn't hear the cars.  A great deal and a great place to stay if you won't be in your room much and if atmosphere isn't important.
